name: Chris Moncada
text: Fantastic people, when noone else would take my case they did and work very diligently on it

name: Maria S
text: I only give them 2 stars for the legal assistants who worked on my case. Karen and Beth are very kind and helpful. The attorneys phoned my case in (literally), had incorrect and missing information, barely communicated with me, and did not argue my position in the least. Only one attorney, I believe her name was Terry, expressed empathy and understanding of my experience and she was not the attorney who appeared in court "on my behalf". The judge asked me exactly 1 question which was "do you have anything to say?". I had a whole list of notes with answers to the prepared questions but was barely given the opportunity to speak. It was never communicated to me that there was missing information or a particular time frame of evidence needed, so I didn't have the opportunity to even try to dig those up. Considering I have been medically neglected my entire life and never able to qualify for insurance when I did attempt employment, of course there are only a few records, and I should have been given the opportunity to find them. Ultimately, I was denied, even though the vocational expert and my medical records confirmed my disabilities and I was ruled medically disabled. I'm all out of options now and resigned to living with my abusive parents until I die old, single, sick, and penniless...

name: Elizabeth Smith
text: Bethany was wonderful and they fought for my dad and sent many prayers for him. We’re so happy and pleased and would definitely use them again. Don’t hesitate to check them out. We are blessed .

name: Dora Hurt
text: Very important meeting

name: Amber Nickelson
text: Very nice people, they are currently representing a loved one of mine and they have so much compassion towards him. Anytime I call them for an update I'm on the phone at least 5-10 mins, because they want to know all about his well being. Only met the lawyer once, I mainly speak to the ladies in the front. (secretaries/ representatives I'm guessing)

name: Molly Hannah
text: At first, the office and it's employees treated me with a good amount of respect. Towards the end of run, they became extremely rude and pushy. Called the secretary the day of my hearing and she decided it was best to chew me out for not calling her when I had been in constant contact with them and for not knowing 100% what to do. At my hearing, they didn't have my 2018 work history, which was provided to the secretary prior to my first hearing date that was cancelled. They also did not file on all the issues, despist some of them being a current issue. My attorney was a wonderful person, despist whoever works the front desk.

name: Emily Bridges
text: Very friendly and informative I have total faith in my lawyers at Pitts and zanaty

text: Doesn't look busy

name: Donovan Sims
text: Mr. Barclay is an exceptional attorney. I have heard from other justices and attorneys, that he is a wealth of knowledge and really encourages its sharing. He treated my family very well. Highly recommend!

name: Melanie Earley
text: I would love to thank Mr. Barclays for his ethics & integrity. He is a man with honor & believe in the rule of law.

name: Bex T
text:
I highly rate Jerry in both his profession and as a person.
He is attentive, thorough and an absolute dream to communicate with.

While he was representing my partner, Jerry made him feel at ease, well supported and that he genuinely had his best interests at heart.

During this time, Jerry was superb at keeping myself in the loop, reassuring me and taking the time to respond to my many questions.
I found that I could really talk to him like I would a good friend as he is approachable, compassionate and excellent at explaining legal processes fully, clearly and concisely.

Overall, my partner and I feel blessed to have worked with Jerry, and we’re both massively grateful for not only his work and the outcome he achieved, but also for the way in which he really instilled a much needed sense of hope, eradicated unnecessary stress and made the whole court process significantly easier to deal with practically, mentally and emotionally.

Highly recommend!

name: Darryl Robinson
text: WENT TO THIS ATTORNEY AS A PROXY FOR MY FRIEND, I WAS EXPECTING A STERN STERILE ENVIRONMENT TO MY DELIGHT IT WAS 100% OPPOSITE WARM ENGAGING AND INVITING AND IT STARTED WITH THE SECRETARY SHE WAS TREMENDOUS AND CONVERSATIONAL NOT STANDOFFISH BUT A REAL PERSONALITY, ATTORNEY BARCLAY WAS THROUGH BUT REALLY CONCERNED ABOUT THE CASE, GAVE ALL OPTIONS AND HELPFUL SUGGESTIONS!!DO YOUR SELF A FAVOR IF YOU ANY LEGAL CONCERNS SEE ATTORNEY BARCLAY ESQUIRE " I HAVE THE UNFORTUNATE EXPERIENCE OF DEALING WITH A LOT OF LAWYERS IN MY LIFETIME AND  IM PLEASED AND PROUD TO SAY NONE NONE BETTER THAN ATTORNEY BARCLAY "YOU BEST BEELEEVES THAT "

name: Benjamin Irvine
text: Jerry...Has been my lawyer for a while now and his talent is obvious. His style is to prevent anything from getting to trial  having it cleared up and dismissed without ever going to court. He's a legal Jedi and he knows whats coming. Lawyers in Huntsville seem to arbitrarily charge whatever they want but Jerry will price you fairly and he'll do it better than they will. Approach him professionally and respectfully and he'll be your best friend just like he is with all the law enforcement officers and judges and prosecutors in this town. He's an insider and the best legal talent anyone could ask for.

name: Jameson Sarratt
text: Jerry is an outstanding lawyer and an even better person.

His paralegal also was nonchalant in communication as she doesn't care.  I would not recommend him to a dead dog and I have contacted Legal Shield and recommend  that he be removed from Legal Shield as he does not represent or stand for what Legal Shield is about.  As an attorney -  they should fight for their clients and he is not a great attorney nor his staff.  DO NOT RETAIN JOHN R. CAMPBELL or you will be better off hiring a donkey.

resp.text:
Dear Mr. Knowles,

I regret that you are unhappy with the outcome of your case, which was concluded when you indicated to the judge in open court that you understood and approved the agreement with your ex-wife for the entry of a judgment against your ex-wife, for which judgment your ex-wife has been paying since.  My records show that the judgment was entered and sent to you in January of 2017, some seven months prior to your review.  You have been notified immediately upon receipt of all payments made against the judgment, and you directed my office to hold those payments for you while you were in the process of moving.   Since that time, you have picked up all of the payments that your ex-wife has sent to this office.  Your ex-wife has your new address to send further payments directly to you.  I understand that you have also sought to garnish your ex-wife, and my paralegal communicated to you the cost of a consultation for further proceedings, which you declined to pay.  My paralegal did then  direct you to the appropriate clerk's office at the courthouse so that you could initiate further collection proceedings on your own if you chose to do so, even though your ex-wife has been making payments against the judgment.  I certainly appeared at the trial setting at which we obtained the judgment  against your ex-wife.  If you had wanted me to appear at any subsequent proceedings, you would have had to arrange for my further representation, which you did not.

name: Josh Kemp
text: I used Mr. Campbell for my divorce/child custody case. It was an uncontested divorce except for the fact that my ex wanted child support. Well, I didn't know any better, and I knew she wouldn't sign the papers if there was no child support so I agreed to give her what Mr. Campbell had come up with: $400. My ex originally wanted something like $650 per month so I looked at that as a win. Well, after talking with different people who have joint legal and physical custody like I do, they wonder why in the hell am I paying my ex ANY child support, since I have her week on and week off. And, after talking with two different lawyers, they wonder the same thing. The lawyer I have now told me if I'd taken our case to court, the judge would NOT have awarded child support to my ex. We will be going back to court needless to say, will definitely not be using Mr. Campbell who screwed me over.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Kemp, I appreciate the opportunity to have assisted with your case, but I do wish you had taken an opportunity to follow up with me about these concerns.  I did leave a message for you to call me concerning this matter, but I have not heard back from you.  I can address your concerns here.  As you might recall, you came to me to fix the agreement that you had tried to file on your own and that the court had rejected.  Without going into the details of the numbers involved with your case (which details are a matter of record) I can confidently say that you would likely have been ordered to pay around $400 per month in child support if you were awarded true joint physical custody after a trial.  If you had tried your case and been awarded joint legal custody, with your wife being awarded sole physical custody, you would have likely been ordered to pay around $650 per month.  Note that there is a difference between joint physical, versus joint legal, custody.  In Alabama, child support must still be calculated, and the judge still must state whether or not Rule 32 has been followed, even in joint physical custody situations.  This means that one party who makes significantly more than the other may still have to pay an amount of child support, and the method used to calculate $400 per month in your case is one that is accepted by the courts.  If two people make the same income, or have an agreement to deviate from guidelines, it is possible to have an order without child support.  Those conditions were not present in your situation.  The alternative would have been to pay me (or another lawyer) much more money to take your case to trial, and make an argument for custody and support, the result of which would not have been a certainty (and could result in less favorable terms of custody and having to pay more support than your agreement).  I'll be glad to explain this to the other persons that have provided feedback to you, as I fear that they must be either misinformed as to the facts or the law.  I am glad to have had the opportunity to assist you, and I will be happy to follow up with you concerning any questions that you have about this matter.

text:

At least they will have one after today!!!   Along with the states attorney general.

Mr Kreps.   Thank you for your response.  And yes. We have both been able to generate public records at this along.  I won’t go to low and degrading levels implying that you have mental issues as you have done so.  I can see how your law firm works first and and responds to complaints by trying to belittle them on a public forum.  Is t it nice to be able to take pics of your responses off records before you edit them.

resp.text: We love all of our potential and current clients.  Everyone has the right to post something negative online so this is a safe space for you to vent.  I’ve been doing this for almost 20 years and have seen most everything and dealt with all different types of people.  We tried to reach out to you three times by telephone to figure out what it is that you were upset about but you refuse to answer the phone and actually talk to us.  I guess you are busy working on your complaint to the attorney general’s office and the Alabama State Bar (both of which we welcome you to file by the way - that is your right).  So, let me get this straight - you were visiting Alabama from Texas and you received a speeding ticket. You waited about a month and contacted our law firm to ask for help in handling the ticket.  We responded immediately, gave you the care and concern that you were seeking, went over the process with you and your options.  We quoted you a very reasonable fee and told you what we could do in order to resolve the case.  You told us that was too much and you were going to pay the ticket and move on - obviously that would not be based on our suggestion because we ALWAYS try to avoid a conviction for our clients (and we are a traffic ticket defense law firm... that you contacted for help).  Presumably, before you paid the ticket, you attempted to communicate on your own to try and get the ticket resolved (which every defendant out there has the right to do - only most people would do that first before contacting us but I guess that didn’t occur to you).  You then called us back and were upset because you resolved the ticket on your own…allegedly - after checking, it is clear that no resolution has been entered into the state system.  We love you man - but whatever it is that is troubling you has nothing to do with us - we hope you get whatever it is straightened out.  As for the frivolous complaints you have tried to threaten us with to the Alabama Attorney General’s office and the Alabama State Bar - bring it on.  We fight like hell for ourselves just like we fight like hell for our clients.  And another thing you may want to keep in mind - the goal of resolving a traffic ticket is so that you have no conviction and presumably no public record of it.  But, you sir, have done a great job of creating a public record of it for whatever reason and for the entire world to see.  Best of luck to you.  Joseph C. Kreps

They send you a checklist of what to do prior to the court date, they represent you in court, pay the court costs, and that’s it.  Communication was limited and only conducted when needed.  Cost me more than just paying the citation, but saved me from having points in my license.

name: Butch Pinkston
text:
Complete and utter waste of money.  After spending $500 with these hacks, I’m in a WORSE position than when I started.

The entire operation is run by a para-legal through text messages.  They promise everything but deliver nothing.  Total cookie-cutter law, no interest in actually defending a case.  I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous bull-sh*t from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.

resp.text:
* Thank you so much for your comments about my law firm - we certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback. We ❤️public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
The only issue in reaching out to you is that we do not know who you are and this is the first we have heard of any problem such as the one you describe - unfortunately, we do not currently have and have never had a client by the name of Butch Pinkston.  If I personally have an issue with a business, I usually contact the business directly and try to resolve whatever it is that is going on.  Businesses don’t get to make things up or hide behind fake names on the internet - I am as transparent as it gets and all of my actual clients know this.
*I have been practicing law for 16+ years and have successfully resolved 17,000+ charges for clients over that period of time.  I am a man - through and through - if someone has a problem with me, all they have to do is explain what the issue is and if I have made a mistake, then I am glad to admit the mistake, apologize and fix it.  That is the measure of a man.
Anyone that knows me and that I have helped knows that I am not a hack, a liar or deceitful - far from it.  If only a successful law practice could be run with a paralegal through text messages - but as you would know if we actually represented you, when someone hires us they are able to text us (and our clients LOVE this option), email us, they get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) to talk with my staff, they also get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) with an attorney and also, get our direct dial so all they have to do is call us with a question or issue or to schedule a call with anyone that works for me or an attorney (myself included).
* You don’t get to the level we are and have the impeccable reputation across Alabama and the country that I have by “promising everything but delivering nothing.”  Close to 100% of our charges we handle are ultimately dismissed - if that is “cookie-cutter law” then so be it.  Apparently, our clients love having their charges dismissed.  We have the utmost interest in defending cases - our actual clients know this.  Every single time we speak to a potential client or go over case resolutions with our clients, our goal is to develop options with the ultimate goal of having the charge(s) dismissed.  Once we have options on the table, we go over those options and our clients get to decide how to proceed - we don’t force anyone to accept any offer on the table and are always available to continue fighting, take the case to the next level or have a trial.  It is our client’s case and they get to decide.
* Wow - in your review you said, “I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous BS from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.”  Really?  You expect the cops and the government to lie?  What a sad, sad worldview you have - which explains the many false statements you made while hiding behind a fake name.  I practice law to relieve human suffering - period.  No other reason.  I love people - even the people that choose to post random diatribes attacking me on the internet.
*I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) and review the info about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama for clients located all over the world.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.   Joseph C. Kreps * Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

name: A Google User
text:
Where do I begin? I was arrested for DUI, Open Container, and speeding. I spent 10  hours in jail thinking my life would never be the same again once these charges  permanently stained my record. At first, I figured there was no point in hiring a lawyer  considering the fact that I was caught dead to rights. I was caught speeding. I was  caught with open container. I blew a .11 once I got to the station. What further proof  would they need to charge me with a DUI? How could I possibly get out of that? A  month went by and I still hadn't hired a lawyer. I got to thinking about it and I figured I  would try and find a good DUI attorney to at least provide some good advice before  entering my case single handedly. I then did some research, and happened to stumble  upon Attorney Joseph C Kreps' YouTube videos online that explained what would  happen if I were actually charged with these convictions. They were so enlightening that  I couldn't help but give this guy a call to see if he could help with my case. I gave him a  call & after getting my information & case details; one of the first things his secretary  mentioned was that they may be able to get the sentence reduced to a public  intoxication. I was astounded, thinking there's no way. I was caught dead to rights. I'm  going down. No doubt about it. I then decided to pay the fee and to hire Attorney Joseph  C Kreps' as my DUI Defense Lawyer (not NEAR as high as what I was quoted from  other firms). His very helpful team then guided me through the process of completing a  series of tasks that would help my case. I completed a questionnaire and a few other
simple tasks that would, in fact, turn out to help my case tremendously. A month later, I  was scheduled to arrive in court on a Wednesday. On a Monday afternoon prior to my  court date, I received a phone call that explained to me that I wouldn't need to show up  in court on Wednesday and that there was a high possibility that my case was going to  be dismissed. I was absolutely thrilled. How could this happen? I was caught dead to  rights! Two days later I received a phone call and an email from the firm saying that if I  completed a level two CRO, 20 hours of community service, and paid a $600 fine plus  court costs, that all charges were to be dismissed! My entire future was left in the hands  of Attorney Joseph C Kreps, and I couldn't have put it in a better place. I now have no  DUI charges and no open container charges on my record. I'm telling you from  experience, this man and his firm are the absolute best DUI Defense Firm you could  possibly hire for your case. ­ If you have a DUI pending ­ Stop what you're doing ­ Call  this firm. It will be the best call you've ever made.

We don’t want any trouble with you - you know that - but if a review is posted with false information then that is not fair and everyone would agree with that.  We certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback.  We ❤️ public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
We never claim to be perfect and certainly don't want anyone to think that we are perfect.  As you know, Brooke, we did not represent you.  We represented your partner who is going through the immigration process in the United States of America. We take great pride in the knowledge and the experience that we have over the last 15+ years in handling and resolving 13,000+ charges all over the State of Alabama. When I was made aware of these issues, we reached out to you to try to resolve it within hours and on the next business morning 7-18-18.  When we did reach out ASAP, you went on and on and then hung up on us before we could even talk.  We tried to call back to no avail.  I personally tried to call back to no avail.
The first and most important thing that I would like to point out is that BOTH of the actual client’s charges were DISMISSED.  And it wasn’t just a “traffic ticket”.  He had 2 charges one of which was failure to obey police/fireman.  Immigration is a difficult process and who knows how this could have seriously impacted his immigration issues - that process and system is ALWAYS CHANGING as everyone knows… but it shouldn’t impact him now because we got BOTH OF HIS CHARGES DISMISSED 😉!
As to the class that was required of him, we are sorry that his time was taken from him in order to do that - our main concern was and is his immigration status and getting the charges dismissed.  His completing a class while his lawyers worked through issues beyond anyone’s control seems like a small price to pay to continue the long and difficult process of becoming a legal United States 🇺🇸 Citizen.
It is important for anyone reading this to know that we did email you the DISMISSAL disposition of BOTH CHARGES back in March 2018... and heard not a peep out of you until this review surfaced almost 4.5 months later.  It is baffling.  We love deeply and dearly every single one of our clients and their friends and family including your partner and also you, Brooke.  We still love you no matter you might post about us.  This is the truth because our love for our clients and our love and passion for our work and the system is not dependent on how others think or feel about us because we know the truth and our love is our love no matter what - it’s just who we are.
I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) at any time and see all of the great information about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.  We love what we do because we love people and we love to help people - it’s why I am alive and why I was put on this earth and called to do this type of work.
Much love to you, Brooke, and your partner.  If you change your mind and desire to speak to me then I am always here and always willing to talk.  If you or any family members need our help again in the future, please let us know as we would be honored to assist and help you with anything that comes up.
Joseph C. Kreps
Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

name: EddyGordo21
text:
My mother has been dealing with this law firm for an abundance of years, and her experience has been far from stellar. This place moved three times since she has been their client, and they never informed her until she called them herself because they do not contact her. David, the person with whom she asks to speak, is constantly dodging her because he is always "out of the office" or "with another 'more important' client." I'm sure NONE of those "more important" clients have been as equanimous with them as she has.

David has apparently trained his staff to dodge her as well since she called them, and Alice refused to answer the phone (probably because of caller ID) but when I called, she answered the phone just to place us on hold to retrieve something so minuscule that it took less than 30 seconds to do...

Apparently this lawyer and his team care nothing about their clients--and dare I say clients of color... But this is the behavior that is typical of many businesses in the north central region of Alabama. Once the better business bureau is contacted, however, maybe they will change their tone.

If she had not contacted the actual courthouse to get her court date, she would not have even known of the impending court date. After calling these people several times, they refused to give her any of her case details.

So with regard to the other negative review this institution has received, I do NOT agree with the owner that "it is the work of a competitor." I have seen these practices first-hand, and I am far from a capital seeking adversary.

resp.text:
Because we don't recognize your name and you don't appear to be a client of our firm, based off your screen name, there's no way for us to address this issue without knowing the exact name of the client. We also do not have, nor have we ever had, any employees by the name of David or Alice. Are you sure you have the correct firm?

In relation to your comment about "people of color," approximately half of our clients are non-caucasion clients and are "people of color." We have dedicated this firm to representing clients who have been injured, oppressed, overlooked and not been treated fairly, regardless of their designation. Over the years, the lawyers and staff of our firm have also volunteered countless hours of their personal time participating in charities and outreach programs that benefit all segments of our community.

Although we're respectful of your opinion, the assertions you've made about the issue of race are reckless and inaccurate and thats clearly proven by 17 years of close relationships with people of all genders, races and socio-economic statuses that are repeat clients. Many people leaving reviews on this very site are "people of color" and would strongly disagree with your statement and actually take offense to it. Writing a negative review about a business that's never represented you is one thing but making baseless accusations of racial unfairness about people you don't know and who have spent their careers representing underprivileged segments of our state and communities is something else.

If your mother is dissatisfied with any service that any lawyer or staff member of our firm has ever provided, then please have your mother, personally, reach out immediately and ask for the head practice manager so that we can rectify this matter.

We take any client dis-satisfaction very seriously and want every client to be satisfied with our efforts. If your mother is, indeed, a past or current client, then any concerns your mother has will be given our complete attention and we will do our very best to address her concerns.

text: I recently hired Kris Sexton for a custody case. Kris and Hannah were absolutely the best decision my husband and I made in selecting a legal team. They took the time to get to know me as a person as well as the entire story and the case. They worked so very hard for me and it showed it court. I truly thank them from the very bottom of my heart ❤️ .

name: Jerica Anthony
text:
I called Next Step Family Law after hearing many friends talk about how good they are. I’m SO happy I did! With only two days until court I went in for a consultation with Coby Boswell. From the time I walked in the door, they were very welcoming and understanding. I felt better immediately after the consultation and decided to go with them.
I am so grateful I did.
Mr Boswell and his team managed to get all of my scattered information together and build my case for me. They would call to check in and see how things were going. I felt like I had a support group outside of my support group.
I was having a difficult time with everything before I had talked to Mr Boswell. He reassured me that everything was going to be fine and it was.
Mr Boswell and Cheryl did an amazing job.
We had discussed what I wanted to come from this custody case and they stood strong and made sure that’s exactly what I got.
If you need an attorney for family law I highly recommend Next step family law!!!!! This team of people are hardworking and dedicated individuals. I wouldn’t change my decision if I could. I want to say thank you to Next Step for working with me on such short notice. Thank you for standing by me and getting the job done. I’m truly blessed to have had a great team stand by me through this hard time. Definitely Five Stars!!!

name: Tracy BrownBeauty
text:
It saddens me to read all of the positive glowing reviews describing the work of Mrs. Shoen to be expeditious, through, responsive and accurate knowing that my family's experience has been nothing short of borderline passive aggressive, unresponsive and non transparent almost from the very beginning. This harrowing experience began for my family and I around the end of August of 2018 when my beloved uncle died unexpectedly. We began paperwork for me to administer estate by which this process has been grossly bumbled through and fumbled 95% of the time. Mrs. Shoen didn't keep my family and I updated as to the status of the case and judges wishes at any point in time. Nor did she even bother to let us know that court dates had been canceled due to heirs requests for extension. Nor did she return our phone calls or emails in a timely manner despite being paid $1000 up front to get started on our case. Then she all of a sudden calls me hurriedly around Thanksgiving black Friday  to request the remaining funds due to be paid which was not in line with our original verbal agreement. I contested her request and the amount was decreased to $228 with the remaining to be paid after estate opening. After this scenario, things all seemed to go downhill rapidly.  Heirs we calling my family with information from probate we had no knowledge of despite having hired Kayla to be our representative which was disheartening and also very stressful. To date we have had 3 canceled court dates on technicality of not having all necessary actions completed prior to court by my attorney. My last court date was June 26 at 2pm by which I spent the entire month or so prior trying to contact Kayla for confirmation and a check in to ensure our readiness to move forward. My calls and texts were not answered and
I never heard anything back from her. Not even a return email was received until the day before the court date. Mrs. Shoen apologized in her email for her gross negligence in handling my uncle's case and said she had closed her practice and that she was withdrawing herself from my case and mailing my case file and a refund check for all money's paid back to me. I spoke with her about this on June 25th. I asked that she send me the USPS confirmation so that I could follow up on the file and refund myself, but she never sent it. Today it is July 5, 2019 and I still have not received anything by mail as promised and also no response to my follow up email...Throughout all this long drawn out process my mom has fallen Ill and lost 40lbs due to stress. To boot, I am dealing with my own distinct stresses in trying to get this estate resolved for my mom because my uncle was her best and only close friend.  I know Kayla may not understand this because it isn't her family or her mom. I understand that Mrs Shoen has been dealing with quiet a few deeply challenging issues of her own here lately and that's why I've been so lenient as I know she is probably still learning how to juggle lifes difficulties simultaneously with lifes obligations and workplace responsibilities. I have compassion for her and truly wish her the best in life but there was left much to be desired from the very minimal level of care attention and concern given to our case. I just wish I would known this before hand as my mom and I have wasted an entire year and still have yet to even get the estate opened. I'm so disappointed, stressed and literally exhausted from this process and dealing with lackadaisical representation has made this process the most cumbersome experience ever. At least when I finally get the file and refund I can move on with my life. I pray and wish I had had the same positive experience as some others have had.

While I sincerly hope that I am never in another situation that would call for it, I would happily use this law firm again and/or refer them to any friend or family member in need of legal representation.

text: Extremely rude employees. Called to collect debt that I asked them to call me back on because I was at work at the moment. They never called. They called this afternoon to ask for a payment. When I was talking to the rep, I explained to her that I never received a follow up call or any letters that she mentioned. She told me that I would not receive a call from a collection agency (not true but whatever) and that I should have gotten the letter with a number to call. Again, no letter. When I let her know I could not call because I had no number or information, she said I could save their number and then proceeded to hang up on me before I could give her any payment information. When I called back, the receptionist laughed when I asked to speak to her. The lady they connected me with then proceeded to have a VERY condescending attitude towards me. They really need to work on their customer service or get new people that know how to talk to customers.

The 2nd court date, Mr Day had other cases that he said were a priority over mine, so we had another continuance, again after me taking a day off work.  On top of things not being handled, he and the office did not know the history and issues of my case, I had to repeatedly point out things and remind them of the history. My case should have been very simple. Maybe he handles complex cases well, but my experience has been very bad.  The staff is very unprofessional and not helpful. I did not feel like I had an advocate, and feels like a complete waste of money.

text: Brent and Crystal worked extremely hard to make sure I was taken care of and that our case went smoothly. Great both in and out of court.

name: Avery
text: After a series of unfortunate circumstances I was, apparently, on the wrong side of the law due to the vicious nature of a former family member.. My innocence was proved in fruition, mainly due to the guidance and circumstantial diligence this law firm has provided me. I personally want to thank Brent Day, Krystal Ivy, and all the people behind the scenes back in the office. They absorbed the same amount of pent-up anger I had, but redirected in to more of a productive manner.  I had three charges against me, all of which was dropped because of the preserverence this law firm had.. I couldn't have done it without them!

name: Danita Booth
text: Brent Day is a great attorney. He helped me through my situation and continued to assist me afterwards  with further service. I would recommend Brent day to anyone in need of a great attorney.

name: Rodney Lewis
text: MOST READ: I would like to start by saying, I very rarely leave a review, but not only is this one much-needed it's also very near to my heart. As a good father not many people even believe we exist. So, there isn't many people going out of their way to help us. Here at Solon Law it's different. I didn't know what to do when my son was took from me. When I spoke with Dragan he called me in immediately and help assure me in what to do. Then Jasmine assisted with my financial services, which was a big concern of mine. She then set me up with Crystal who allowed me to vent and explain the situation. I was upset and lost. Crystal helped me EVERY step of the way to do what was best for my son. Then Brent came in and put it all together in that court room. It wasn't about winning a case, nor the money, but it was all about doing what was best for my son. Even if that meant him staying with his mother. For that I am thankful. Thank you Solon Law family for helping me get my son back. This team was a gift from God. Good dad's come here for help, but if you just trying to get back at your ex...better go elsewhere lol. They care about your child like it's their own. I love these guys.

I am in a worse situation now than when I hired him with no assistance offered after he received payment.  Buyer beware!!
* Update 5/2/2020:  Well he finally responded to my last email, 8 months later and AFTER he read this review. Good to know he reads these. Perhaps a simple phone call would have been more appropriate than a letter containing a veiled threat to pursue legal action if I don't remove this review. Mr. Maples, you shouldn't put yourself out there on Google for review by clients if you can't accept my honest opinion of the value of the service I paid you for and trusted you to deliver.

name: Sun Shyne
text:
Attorney Janet Cox of Cox Disability Law, LLC represented me on my appeal hearing.  I'm 48 yrs old and I felt that my case was going to be a difficult one to prove. There were 2 reasons why I thought the judge's decision would be unfavorable; my age and my disability weren't supported by any medical documentation, such as X-ray's, CT-scans, Ultrasounds. Plus, the treatment for my condition was the cause of my condition. I was suffering from other conditions that had been documented over the years by several physicians in various disciplines. Atty Cox wanted to focus primarily on Abdominal & Pelvic Adhesive Disease as the culprit, and casually mention the other conditions. Yes, I was concerned with her thought process due to the fact this condition had the least amount of supporting medical documentation. In that moment I agreed, she was the professional and because she had worked for the  Social Security Administration in the administrative law division.  It was called the Office of Hearings and Appeals at the time.  She had received extensive legal training on the Social Security Act and the Code of Federal Regulations. Also, she had received medical training to learn medical terminology, as well as about injuries and disease processes that can interfere with a person's ability to hold a job. We filed my appeal July 2016 and my hearing Sept 2018. During the hearing with ADJ the ruling was favorable. I haven't seen a dime yet but I know it's coming. Attorney Cox's and her team knows their stuff, trust them and they will get it done for you. Anytime I felt unsure I would call or email, they always replied timely. Also, you as a client have to be thorough in making sure that the physician has noted your conditions in your medical file and request a copy of medical notes, lab reports and any tests that are taken for your personal file and make copy for attorney. Remember you are your best advocate for your disability ...Thank you!
-Tanya
Birmingham, AL

resp.text:
Thank you for your kind review. I have successfully represented a client with your same issues just last month. Very difficult medical conditions to live with. You handle your struggles with tremendous grace. I wish the best for you in the future!
Janet Cox

She was very thorough, precise, and caring in her work. She made sure we were always up to date on what was going on with my mothers case, and showed so much more interest and care than anyone else we'd worked with over the years. Only a year and a half later, June of 2017, she was able to successfully get my mother approved for disability. I cannot express in words how much my mother needed this, and how thankful we are to Janet Cox for her didication and hard work. I highly recommend this law firm to anyone and everyone who feels they are at a dead end with their struggles, and even those who are not. My mothers life is inifinetly easier now, all thanks to the Cox Disability Law Firm.

After several years of declining health issues, then getting laid off after 20 years of service because of my health, I found myself in dire straits as my allotted 6 months of unemployment benefits were being consumed every week with no hope insight.  I finally came to the realization that I had to take evasive action to secure my financial future or loose it all.  With an unimaginable problem laying ahead of me I knew that I had to put my trust in the hands of The Good Lord who then led me to the internet and eventually to the Cox and Reynolds web site where I then called and with one of professional staff members who helped me, step by step fill out the required Social Security Disability claim for
After the preliminary Claim form was completed and emailed to The Government, i knew that I had taken the appropriate action to save my family and their home.

Two and a half months after my initial inquiry and form submittal, The Government approved 100% of my Social Security Disability  clam which is almost unheard of from a time perspective.

Yes, Thanks to The Cox and Reynolds Legal Team,  Cox and Reynolds K over 60 years working Social Security Disability experience  and weekly discussion with The Firms professional staff, my family and my house has been saved from Foreclosure and Bankruptcy.

Thanks Cox and Reynolds... Job well done!!

R. Gentry

Instead, Randall represented us everytime and was Our Voice in court when we weren't present. Every time after a court hearing, more and more worked in our favor. He convinced the judge if one more slip up from my wife's ex then our daughter (my step daughter) would come back home to Amarillo,Texas on a one way ticket permanently. Better yet, our daughter and her father moved back to Texas in fear of losing custody. Randall was outstanding and Mary(his assistant) was So Extremely Friendly. Both Down to Earth! Is he recommended? With No Doubt! A True Blessing!
Randall, Thank You!

text: Ms. Sullivan was assigned Guardian ad litem for my daughter. Court was postponed 6 months, but she never met my daughter until the morning of court for about 3 minutes. She negotiated an acceptable but not favorable arrangement to be offered during the proceeding. There was no objection to the arrangement, and the judge gave approval also. Then it was conveniently left out of the order and the court denied having the order corrected to reflect what was agreed to in court on behalf of my daughter and her safety. In my opinion, Ms. Sullivan is not an advocate for the child in the cases she handles. At least she wasn’t for my daughter.

name: Tara Duhe
text:
As the GAL (“attorney for the child” ) in my 2 year long custody case: Ms. Sullivan failed to do her job as a Guardian Ad Litem in every way possible. Upon my initial meeting with her I provided her a list of 5+ references as requested. She did not contact one of them while doing her Due diligence as a guardian. Typically in Mobile, AL the judges put their faith in the GAL that they appoint to a case, for a recommendation that is in the best interest of the child/children. Unfortunately she based her custody recommendation in my case on her financial benefit, rather than our child. Coupled with the fact that the lawyer representing the other party was her very good friend- Alison Herlihy. I have never heard of nor seen the amount of corruption that I experienced first hand because of these women. Her report was garbage from the first word. Even the fees she charged didn’t make sense and were full of errors. My fee was $400. His was $3000. She picked him, before we started.

Ms. Sullivan’s father was a judge in Mobile in the 80’s (Jimmy Sullivan) and went to federal prison for corruption - Taking a bribe. What I can say with absolute certainty, is that the apple did not fall far from the tree.

After you have gone through the fire of a difficult, highly technical or highly-important legal battle with him, you will come to love him and appreciate him just as I do.  I cannot say enough about Mr. Chris Money to explain just how incredible he is.   Do yourself a favor, if you are facing a legal matter that requires the service of an attorney, don't waste your time with anyone else. text: My first experience was really terrible. After the third and final complaint Andy stepped in and took over. He did a great job getting a good settlement in a short period of time and it was well overdue since the case was pretty clear. I was tired and weighed down from dealing with everything overall but in the end it was worth the wait. Thanks Andy!

resp.text:
Hi Tameka, customer service is always our top priority and we apologize you did not experience that in the beginning. We hold our attorneys to a very high standard, and the lawyer who originally worked with you is no longer employed by the firm.

I appreciate you bringing your concerns to me, and I endeavor to remain available to every client who chooses to work with my firm.

I'm are glad that we were able to make it right in the end, and I apologize for any experience that you had that was not up to our high standards.

name: Cynthia Wilson
text: I have to say that I am extremely impressed with this law firm! If you are anything like me, you may think that, in the legal world, you are nothing unless you are a client bringing in money to them. Well that is completely untrue with this law firm! I called them for advice on what step I should take next after an accident with minor injuries. The receptionist who answered the phone helped me as much as she could with my general questions and then passed my information on to a member of their legal team. From there,  Billy Elliott called and was one hundred percent HONEST with me and didn't try to take advantage of my legal ignorance. He took the time to give me some extrmely valuable advice over the phone without ever being retained by me! He gave me detailed explanations and responses to my questions and really helped me to figure out what I should expect from the insurance company! I am positive that this will be my go-to legal firm for all future incidents and the one I would recommend to anyone who is looking for an attorney. If you are on the fence about who to use, because there are so many out there, LOOK NO FURTHER! Andy Citrin's office and staff are amazing!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the incredible review, Cynthia!  Your kind words made our day ... literally!  We are so very pleased when just being who we are delights our clients and, in your case, our non-clients. Thank you for affirming why we do what we love!

name: Marie Taylor
text:
I had the pleasure of retaining Ms. Donohoe through a personal referral. This was a complex personal injury case which could have been drug out for years. From the on-set, I found her to be very professional and focused on my needs, not her potential profit. Her level of knowledge, detail and preparation was very impressive. She did not leave anything to chance. She actually examined every possible piece of evidence, spoke with multiple witnesses, and even compiled a comprehensive matrix to determine future medical costs that I will no doubt have to address for a long period of recovery. Again, very impressive and thorough!

Ms. Donohoe, and her staff, made me feel at ease, and very confident that I would prevail in my case. And, I did. In a short time, and without court, she was able to secure a significant settlement that now I can rest knowing that I can cover all of the many medical expenses ahead. Now, I don't have to worry about the career I lost because of extended hospital stays and many, many medical appointments. I don't have to worry about losing my home, my car, my self worth. Because of Cathy Donohoe, I WILL SURVIVE! I will have my life back!

Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this attorney and her entire team!

name: LeAnne Hall
text:
Overall, I am very satisfied with the services of Johnstone Carroll. My calls are always promptly returned, the staff has always been courteous and helpful, and the location is convenient if I need to go by the office.

Legal issues can be overwhelming and time consuming. Seemingly, delays are the norm and the "one step forward, two steps back" mentality can be quite frustrating. Inge Johnstone has always explained complex issues to me in an understandable manner and that makes the process bearable. If I were giving advice to someone seeking the services of an attorney, I would advise them to choose one that WINS and one they like. name: Glenda Dickie
text:
I have known Inge for several years, beginning when he helped my sister with insurance claims regarding her illness.  He was compassionate and kind, meeting with her and encouraging her and working hard to reach a successful settlement.

When I was in need of an attorney after being injured in a car accident, I called on Inge. It was during those months when he was working on my case that I came to know him as a resourceful, tireless advocate and also as a friend. He was always accessible whenever I had a question, always interested in how I was feeling. He was able to obtain a settlement for me that was much more than I had anticipated.

Recently, my elderly dad needed some legal advice.  Again, I sought Inge's help. He took time out of his busy day to talk to us and tell us how to proceed with the issue.

I believe these are the reasons that Inge Johnstone is an effective and successful attorney.  He is a compassionate, kind advocate who is never too busy to take the time to listen to his clients, who he treats as friends.
He then uses his considerable talents as a knowledgeable, resourceful, experienced attorney to work tirelessly to obtain the best possible judgements for his clients.

I highly recommend Johnstone Carroll for anyone who requires legal representation.

resp.text: Glenda, those words mean a lot coming from you. I am honored to have represented you.

name: mary kate watkins
text: I have known Inge Johnstone for almost four years. I was injured in a car wreck when I was 16, and my case took close to three years to settle. During this time, Inge maintained consistent contact. He kept me updated on how things with my case were progressing, he helped me through the deposition process since I had never done it before, and made sure the entire process was as easy as possible for me. I really appreciated that he took the time to get to know me personally and was invested in helping me. I never dreaded having to go to the office, answer a phone call, or reply to an email because he was so friendly, honest, and helpful with me. Overall, I was extremely happy with the work he did. I believe that I could not have found a better attorney anywhere else.

resp.text: Thanks Mary Kate! We really enjoyed getting to know you and look forward to hearing about the great things that you are going to do.

name: Lisa Kennedy
text:
“I have known Mr. Inge Johnstone for over a decade. I was injured in a car wreck and sought legal help with recovering medical expenses as well as damages. My case took almost  three years to settle, during this time Mr. Johnstone maintained consistent contact with me.

He took me to the crash site to go over details of the accident while still fresh in my mind, assisted with finding the proper doctors for medical tests/evaluations, assisted with finding the best physical therapist and prepared me for the deposition process.

He returned my telephone calls promptly and I always felt like he had my best interest in mind. Overall, I was extremely happy with the work he did. He is honest, trustworthy and very personable.  I highly recommend Mr. Johnstone as a personal injury attorney.”

So after having falsified court documents, I called him to get them changed or corrected and his response was that the DA needed what the paraphernalia was so “maybe he should have ran it by us”, it didn’t matter, he couldn’t do anything, and the judge already signed off on it. Then upon exiting the court offered to walk us out just to ask for a review on Google. He was pretty easy to talk to, which was the only thing I had to really say until I saw my falsified documents.

‼️UPDATE‼️: MISUNDERSTANDING WAS CORRECTED AND BRIAN MADE SURE THE DOCUMENTS WERE CORRECTED ON BOTH ENDS AND CONTACTED ME IMMEDIATELY WITH FILED/APPROVED CORRECTIONS. I highly recommend using his services! ‼️UPDATE‼️

name: Frank Page
text: In 2012 Mr Dasinger was court appointed to me in a criminal case, I never once met with him,spoke to him, nothing until my court date. I wrote many letters, and my family made many calls to no response. The day of court, he had no idea who I was or anything about my case. All he had to say was the state is sending you to prison and to accept it cause that was my only option. I was young, scared, and had no idea what to do. He on the other hand, played on fb, laughed it up with the states attorney, and my victim. My first and only felony, poss of forged instrument, two checks for less than $50, got me 3 yrs. I got more help from the inmates sitting next to me that day than I got from him. He did NOTHING in my deffense. I do honestly believe the outcome would have been less severe if I had paid him cash, or if I had went with a diffrent lawyer. It has been many years and I do hope he has grown as a lawyer and person since then, but I would not recommend him.

resp.text: Unfortunately, when I held a contract with the State of Alabama as an appointed attorney, I did not have the time to meet with all of the 100+ new clients that I was appointed to represent each month. The numbers were simply overwhelming and impossible to keep up with.  I have not handled court appointed work since 2013 because I wanted to be able to give more personal attention to all of my clients, which I am now able to do.  I'm deeply sorry that I couldn't have helped you more Frank.  I hope all is going well and I wish you a prosperous 2019.

name: Lewis McCluer
text: I'm involved in a landlord-tenant dispute and realized I was over my head and needed help. I contacted the Powell Law Firm and got a consultation with Thomas that day. He also let me know that the firm was always available should the matter get to the point that representation became necessary. When I had further questions as the situation progressed, I called back, but was unable to reach Thomas immediately, as he was in court that day. I left a message with their front desk,  and received a call back from Melvin later that day as Thomas was still in court. He listened intently and further advised me as what I needed to do, and even returned another call in regards to my issue. Both Thomas and Melvin were extremely helpful in what was to me new territory as I had never been in a situation like this before. They stood ready to assist any way they could to include retaining their services should the need arise. As a retired Marine with 26 years service I know professionalism when I see it. Hope I don't need to retain an attorney for this current situation but I have full confidence in them should that need arise. I highly recommend that you contact them in the event you fell you may need the services of an attorney/

I'm pretty sure that conversation should not have been discussed in front of a potential client. As I am sitting there explaining to Mr. Thomas why I am there seeking hes services he was more interested in picking the sores on his leg then paying any attention to anything i had to say, and while he was showing me the bruises from his recent jet ski accident all he could tell me was to seek an attorney immediately. I believe that's what I am here. What he ment was i needed a court appointed attorney because I could not afford him. So with Very unprofessional! name: Donna Michelle Wade
text: Absolutely horrible representation . I gave them $1800 cash for a simple divorce, asked for no desperation of assets, no children involved. Simple divorce that was us mail paperwork, and showing up for final dissolution court hearing. Now they are trying to extort another $625 out of me. Maybe they are "great"  for their rich and privaledged clients, but have no heart or soul for your everyday person. I ran home from an extremely abusive relationship and chose them because they were close by. My mistake . Do your homework and chose a attorney based on your needs, not their's.t

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. Although it is difficult to hear negative feedback, without receiving reviews we can't improve our services in order to provide the best legal services for our clients. From your review, we looked at how we communicate expectations of fees with clients in more detail so there are no surprise fees from filing. We truly appreciate you took the time to leave us a review and hope you are doing well.

name: Gindy Lacey
text: BEWARE ELDERLY!!! Davis and Neal employ a lawyer named Alec Brown who helps with wills for the elderly at the Council on Aging in Baldwin County Alabama. My 87 yr old Grandmother was recommended to hire Mr. Brown to compose a will for her. She was quoted $150 dollars by Mr. Brown for a will. She was quoted by Mr. Brown's secretary $150 dollars for a will. When Mr. Brown completed the simple 2 page will he gave my Grandmother a bill for $225 dollars. My Grandmother is on a fixed Social Security income and had to save 2 months to pay the original quoted price of $150. She offered that $150 to Mr. Brown and he rejected it and took her completed will back to his office. Now my Grandmother is without a will again. I would not recommend this office to anyone else. And the fact that they are supposed to be HELPING the elderly is a disgrace.

name: Sunshine Sanders
text: I want to thank my attorney Eddie MasseyIII and the wonderful staff at Clay, Massey & Associates. My husband and I had been in Mobile county for about a year and a half before my accident and had no clue what firm would represent me fairly, so I asked around and got two recommendations. Long story short, I chose the right one. The wait was long but I’m sure it was what I was going through medical wise. It’s over now and I’m happy with the outcome, so all in all it was worth the wait. I have two special shout-outs, (1) Ms. Sally...if you get her warm friendly voice on the phone it made your day and (2) Dana...she was very efficient and I guarantee, if she’s on the case, it’ll get done....period! I hope that I don’t need them again but if I do, they will represent me. Thanks again guys.

name: Caleb Crager
text: My name is Caleb Crager.I am from Chatom AL.I was injured in an oilfield accident in Oklahoma last Halloween.Since the injury I was never fully able to recover and as time went by I wasn’t aware of the extent of my injury.In turn I suffered from a tbi.Suffering from such an injury is very difficult to explain when Drs may not be able to pinpoint or fully diagnose the actual root of the problem.I was pushed to the side by my employer and from the negligence on their part I felt is was time to seek legal assistance.I spoke with Mr. Ed Massey over the phone and I gave him a brief summary of my situation.Without hesitation he asked to set up a meeting to get more information.Mr. Ed’s concern was first and foremost my health and getting me properly treated.You will not find a more honest man that will hear you out and truly believe in you and what you have to say.Since my employer was out of Texas I would have to find an attorney from that state.Regardless of that Mr. Ed knowing he had nothing to gain from my case has stood by my side and he was able to find me an attorney to take my case.I know Ed and his son would be there for me day or night to assist me anyway they could.My experience with Ed and his son could not have been more professional.I’m thankful to have the privilege to have met Ed and his son Eddie.They were absolutely wonderful.

name: Leiana Polwart
text:
My husband was in a car accident and the other driver’s insurance was hesitant on helping us. They kept giving us the run around and saying “they were investigating”. We googled for accident lawyers near us and Mr Massey was one of the first to pop up. We gave them a call and they saw us the very next day. They were really quick with starting the case and keeping us informed with the progress.
Unfortunately, we were dealing with a shady insurance company who kept dragging out the case as much as they could. It took a couple of months from start to finish but we got our car fixed & my husbands doctor bills paid for. All we had to do was sign a few papers and Mr Massey literally took care of everything for us.
Mr Massey was very persistent with the shady insurance company and his legal assistant Dana was always extremely quick to respond to our questions when we emailed.
If you are looking for quick action, from an excellent family oriented firm, then I would absolutely recommend Clay, Massey & Associates.

name: Melania Escada
text: YOU HAVE TO HAVE THIS LAWYER. Read the reviews. They are real. Personally, I don't know where I would be without Elizabeth Zwiebel being my divorce lawyer. My case started with me being served papers that said my former husband wanted custody of our children. Out of the blue. Without warning I was forced to fight for my children. I could not believe what I was reading. I have always been the full time caregiver for my children. It was astounding to read the words on that paper. Elizabeth greeted me with open arms and understanding words. She explained to me how to best proceed. Her rates were very reasonable especially since I had to hire her on the spot for a hearing in 3 days. She was fantastic in the court room.  Her command of the facts and her preparation was absolutely evident. She knew every detail. She used every bit of the information I gave her to win my case. Without her I don't know where I would be - probably without my children. It was very overwhelming. Her retainer was a no brainer. My family helped me but it was worth every penny. My former husband was way too confident which worked on every single nerve in my body. She told me what was going to happen and every single thing she said happened. It was great to see her work. She stopped the other attorney from running all over me. She straightened out each lie. She worked methodically to get the truth out. I highly recommend her and her team. I would not be where I am without her. Elizabeth, I hope you see this. I cannot thank you enough. From the bottom of my heart - THANK YOU.

resp.text: Thank you Mel. It was a pleasure to work along side you during your case. I work very hard at giving my best to my clients. It makes me very happy when my clients win. I know the stress they feel.  I don't sleep when my clients don't sleep. I worry when they worry. I take it ALL personally. I don't rest until I have done everything I can to make it better for my clients. It was truly a pleasure to work with you and for you.

name: Jessica Sanchez
text: Elizabeth is the best family attorney in Birmingham! She helped me with my custody case and I could not be happier. She fought for me like she was family. She helped me through every situation to make the right choice and as always looking out for my best interest. She made sure I understood every step of the way and answered any questions I had.  She is professional, knowledgeable, honest, and has my complete trust. She went above and beyond my expectations. I highly recommend her.

resp.text: Jessica, is the best. She was such a pleasure to help. I looked forward to bringing to you the result you needed. I wish you and your little family the best.

name: Edward
text:
I found myself recently in a difficult situation that I was very worried about. I knew I would need somebody with lots of experience, empathy for a father fighting for his kids best interests and somebody with a proven record for their clients. She spent 3 hours with me on our first person meeting at the office and she made me feel like my concerns were heard and all outcomes of my potential case were laid out for me. She’s a solid individual who won’t BS you.

If you want somebody that makes you feel secure, understood and has your back then Elizabeth is the only lawyer you will need.

So grateful to have found her to help me!

name: Charles Barbarotta
text: Elizabeth was a pleasure to work with and an experienced lawyer that knew exactly what to do in a bitter custody battle. Her experience and network in the area was invaluable. We were on the verge of securing a victory until another lawyer in a different state made a huge mistake. In court she was a bulldog and knew exactly how to present and counter arguments. She cared about you and was passionate about it, not just caring about getting paid. It was a pleasure to work her and have her on my side. Thank you for everything you did for me. It's a shame that I cannot have you on my side going forward.

name: Emily Willoughby
text:
I have used Elizabeth and her team twice over the past 8 years for custody issues.  Most recently this summer she helped with my son who wanted to live with me in Florida.  Elizabeth worked with my family and I for over 3 months to ensure we did everything the law would allow to give us the best chance at relocation for my son. The end result was she was able to ensure my son was able to speak to the Judge, our side of the story was heard, and we were awarded custody last week.  Elizabeth always kept me informed of the case and offered no promises, but told me exactly what to expect and not what I wanted to hear. Her up front and honest approach kept everything clear and helped relieve stress during this difficult summer. Any time I needed a to call or email a question I had responses within the same day or 24 hours. Roxana, the office manager, was amazing at organizing documents for my case and keeping me informed of absolutely everything.  They are an amazing team!

I would recommend the Zwiebel Law Firm to anyone, especially fathers who are fighting for their children.  She went above and beyond to ensure my side of the story was heard, and she helped bring peace to myself and my family.  I could never thank her enough!  - Josh Willoughby

name: Samantha Reid
text: The Zwiebel Law Firm is the absolute best law firm in Birmingham. I was going through a tough divorce and the previous attorney I had seemed to just want to close my case out and leave me without anything after 20 years of marriage. I knew I needed a new attorney before it was to late. A friend told me about Elizabeth Zwiebel so I gave her a call and her staff was so nice to me and fit me in that same day. As soon as I walked in I was greeted by the girl at the front desk with a big smile. As we waited for me to be called back the young lady and I had a conversation and she made me feel at ease and comfortable. Once I started talking with Elizabeth I knew with her by my side I had a great shot of of winning. It was a process but I came out with alimony, child support and some great friends. The staff at The Zwiebel Law Firm make you feel like family and really care about you. Give them a call TODAY!!

name: Camila Davis
text: The attorneys at The Zwiebel Law Firm are amazing and fair in their pricing. I called and had a consultation the same day! The attorneys took the time to listen and understand my situation. They told me what my next steps were and stood by me the whole way. My ex who loves in Alabama told me it would be impossible for me to get child support since I do not live in Alabama. The Zwiebel Law Firm took care of everything and now I am happily divorced and have primary custody of my child as well as child support. Call The Zwiebel Law Firm for all your needs. I'm glad I did.

text: Elizabeth Zwiebel and her team are very knowledgeable when it comes to child custody cases. I was having a hard time getting visitation with my daughter and Elizabeth came to the rescue and helped me to get visitation. Now I see my daughter and can pick her up everyday from school. She also helped me to have a better relationship with my daughters mother. We are now co parenting our daughter. We are forever grateful to Elizabeth!

name: Martha Iglesias
text: Mrs. Zwiebel and her staff are absolutely the best! I needed to speak with an attorney fast and was able to sit down with her the same day. She listened to me and never once rushed me. She walked me through the whole process. I will forever be grateful to Mrs. Zwiebel and her staff. I highly recommend The Zwiebel Law Firm!

name: Mattie Leason
text: The staff at the Zwiebel Law Firm are so awesome! They got me in right away to see Elizabeth. I hired her as my attorney immediately. I went to the office thinking I was defeated in every way. My husband had beaten me in every court hearing I had attended before I got Elizabeth on board. She had a very uncanny way of getting the Judge to change her mind and listen to me for a change. I got the results I had been praying for every night before meeting Elizabeth and her staff. It was truly a miracle. Everyone at the Zwiebel Law Firm returned my calls and responded to my emails quickly. I even got to enjoy texting with Elizabeth while she was in court on other matters. No matter my emergency or issue at hand, I got answers quickly. She never turned me away. She never thought any issue was too small or too big. She stayed with me through it all. She talked to me so sweetly and kindly that it calmed me down each day. I had never been through divorce before and this was new to me. She understood that. She explained every detail before it happened and she was right 100% of the time. She predicted what would happen and we worked my case like a chess game and won. She showed me how to use every avenue to explore ways to settle but also to make a better case for me. I am so glad I decided to change attorneys in the middle of a case. My child would never be the same without our current custody agreement. If she had not fought for me, I would not have alimony or child support to help me and my child through the difficult times. With her help I was able to find a way to get my child in a better home, better school and afford it all with my alimony and child support.  I am so thankful for her and her staff. Words cannot say enough. Hire her today. You will not regret it ever!

name: Cindy Lineman
text: Child custody is so important and so worth hiring the right person. If I had not hired Elizabeth when I did, I would not be sitting in such a sweet spot today. My child was in a terrible custody arrangement with my ex husband. He was stressed, he was sick all the time, he was anxious every day. She turned all that around for my child. She listened to me and took everything I had to say seriously. She took my case and turned it around for my child's sake. My child needed a voice and she made sure and get a lawyer appointed to represent his needs. She took time to take every call. She took time to respond to every email. She would even answer emails late at night. She didn't mind me asking questions any time of day. She took my case and made my child's life better for doing it. She made the judge and the other attorney understand that my child needed a different schedule.  I am so glad that he is not suffering anymore.  I am so thankful and will be forever thankful that she took the time to resolve our problem in the best possible way. We will never forget her or her staff for the courteous way they helped me.

name: Victoria Waters

My mother lost almost $4,000 from him; in which he promised us some good news for a rule 32 appeal in which he wrote to the States of Alabama  for my brother to get a lesser sentence on his case.

resp.text:
Mr. Richardson, Rule 32's are inherently difficult as you and your family are well aware and were well advised.  They are last ditch efforts after a criminal defendant has been convicted and their appeals denied.  Statistically they have some of the lowest possibility of success in the criminal justice system.  The only thing Eversole Law ever promises anyone is that we will do everything we can to help our clients in any way we can.  And Mr. Richardson, Steven Eversole did not represent your brother, but another attorney in the firm.   You should know that.  Either way,  Mr. Eversole has has great success filing Rule 32 and other post-conviction relief measures for clients, but nothing is ever guaranteed. In 2014 Mr. Eversole himself overturned 287 life sentences and over 2000 years sentence in one case.  In 2013 he overturned a sex crime conviction with life time registration  with an out-of-time Rule 32 Petition in a 26 year old case.  In 2015 Mr. Eversole overturned a several year old drug conviction with another out-of-time Rule 32 Petition.  And again in 2016 Mr. Eversole overturned a 2010, 20 year sentence on a drug trafficking conviction that released our client 15 years earlier on a post conviction relief measure.  And these are just a small accounting of his success. He has won appeals in both criminal and civil matters and been highly successful in both trial and appellate matters in hundreds if not thousands of cases.

Here is just a sampling of Mr. Eversole and the his firm's success: Admitted to practice in All State and Federal Courts in Alabama: •All Alabama State Courts, •Alabama Supreme Court, •Alabama Court of Appeals, •Northern & Middle District of Alabama. Qualifications •Focuses on Criminal Defense and Divorce •Handled thousands of cases •2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 National Top 100 Trial Lawyer •Birmingham Magazine's Top Criminal Lawyer and Top Divorce Lawyer in the same year, 2014 •B-Metro Magazine's Top Lawyer 2016 •B-Metro Magazine's Rising Star 2014 •Newsweek Magazine's Top 14 Criminal Defense Lawyers 2014 •Top 10 Under 40 by the National Academy of Criminal Defense Lawyers •B-Metro Magazine's Face's of Birmingham •AVVO Rate 10/10 •AVVO Top Criminal Lawyer 2015 •AVVO Client Choice Award Winner •Publishes Criminal Defense Blog since 2008 Top Criminal Defense Blog award •Better Business Bureau A+ Rating •Frequent presenter on legal matters •Published several books. Professional & Bar Association Memberships •National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers •Alabama Association of Criminal Defense Lawyer •National Trial Lawyer's Criminal Trial Lawyer's Association •Birmingham Association •National Organization for Reform of Marijuana Laws(NORML) Legal Committee •National College of DUI Defense •Alabama State Bar •Birmingham Bar Association •Shelby County Bar Association

We are sorry your brother's case didn't work out.  But you don't shoot the messenger when the message is bad.  We wish you and your family all the best in future.  God Bless.

resp.text: I am sorry you unsatisfied.  It is hard to reply when we do not know who you or have any knowledge of these allegations you make. Court hearings and trials often run long and we often have little control of the time a hearing may take for various reasons., thus requiring someone to reschedule a meeting now and then,  but we are always prepared for court. resp.text:
Eric K. Roberts was awarded the Client Champion's award in 2017, 2018, and 2019. The Client Champion award recognizes attorneys who "excel at service" to clients. Furthermore, Eric K. Roberts was awarded America's Most Honored Professionals Award in 2018 and 2019.  Eric K. Roberts has been selected as a member of the National Trial Lawyer's Top 100 Attorneys during 2017, 2018, and 2019. Since 2016, Eric K. Roberts has been selected as a member of the National Black Trial Lawyer's Top 100 Attorney in the United States of America.  Locally, Eric K. Roberts has received the Black Owned Business Award (Best Lawyer) in 2017 and 2018. These are a few of the awards that Eric K. Roberts has received while practicing law.
While in law school, Eric K. Roberts started a Civil Rights Organization while at the University of Alabama School of Law. The University of Alabama School of Law is ranked within the top 25 law schools in the nation by US News.  He also received the Order of the Samaritan for his charity work within the community. name: Lori Norris
text:
Hi, I’m Lori Norris. My brother, Jeremy Jerry  was charged with capitol murder charges. Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone Attorneys took his case. They are father and son.
Right from the start they were friendly and professional. They got my brother to be evaluated at Taylor Hardin Secured Medical Center. That is a much nicer place with someone with a mental illness. You got to visit for 2 hrs on the weekends in person. He was going to stay there til his trial. He had several competency hearings. He wasn’t competent. His trial was set for May. We were all grieving and sad. I love my brother no matter what. Then in April I got a call his trial was canceled. He failed his last competency test. I was happy. My brother Jeremy Jerry was going to live in a group home for the rest of his life. With competency hearings every 6 months. He could live somewhat of a life.♥️🙏

If you didn’t read anything else. Dani V. and Sam Bone are great, kind and friendly attorneys. They are professional and work hard to get the job done. They are kind and friendly but they also kick butt! I never thought this would be possible! I am grateful for them the rest of my life. Thank you Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone. I will come to you if I need an attorney in the future for sure.

Lori Norris
