name: Kathy Johnson
text: Divorce is HARD no matter if you want it or not, I don't wish it on anyone. When I was faced with mine in 2019, I was referred to Dani Bone through a coworker and friend that I trusted. I initially hired Dani because I heard he was the very best and he would fight for me. I called and even though they were extremely busy, they saw me right away. After hearing my situation, Dani was honest with me and said, "You need Sam. " My case was very complicated having both personal and business issues, assets and properties to divide, custody and other court issues . Sam took it as a challenge. He stayed with me and guided me through the whole divorce process. It was not easy, it was extremely tough but Sam knew how to handle every situation that came up. When going through a 2 yr battle, you need to know and  feel confident that your attorney has your back and has your best interest at heart. I emotionally fell apart many times and he helped me to learn to stand up for myself and it made me a stronger person through this process. All I wanted was what was fair- he got me exactly what I asked for! I was extremly pleased with services of Sam, Dani and their dedicated and caring staff. Amanda, Fredrick and Osha were just wonderful to work with. The whole staff made me feel comfortable and at ease through a very uncomfortable life circumstance.  While the other party had 5 attorneys through the process , I had one.  I only needed the one team- I had The Best with Sam & Dani Bone. Sam was honest, upfront, bold and encouraging. He never had to be ugly or raise his voice in court or trial and never once belittled anyone. I recall him saying, "It doesn't have to be ugly". Being a Christian, a professional, a self employed woman, a Realtor and a mother of 2, this was imperative to me. Sam treated both parties with total RESPECT always . That was very important to me.  I did my part and provided the true facts, evidence and proof- he did his part and presented my case with true professionalism , Integrity and no one was disrespected in the process. I would 💯 percent recommend Sam & Dani Bone if you want to be represented by someone who will always have your back and is not afraid to fight for your best interest. Thank you Sam, Dani, and your amazing team. If I ever need attorney services in the future , I will use you again and will highly recommend you to anyone that I know. You Rock!

name: Bernadette Wineman
text:
Earlier this year, I found myself in need of a divorce attorney when my ex petitioned to modify our final judgment. I no longer lived in Alabama and was unsure of where to turn for legal advice. After consulting with Mr. Sam Bone, it was clear that he had a deep understanding of law and how it applied to my particular situation.

Many attorneys will promise the moon, without being able to deliver a star. Sam will be honest about your case, talk with you about the possibilities, and develop a plan to protect your best interests. Phone calls/emails are answered promptly and you are made aware of appointments and court actions. Even though my case was regular family law issues, it was treated as a priority.

When emotions run high and people play dirty, you need an attorney that will keep you focused. It was nothing short of a blessing to have Sam’s counsel during this time. Sam will listen and use what will benefit your case most, helping you to make the best decisions.

Through my experience, I learned that Sam is wise beyond his years and holds a unique combination of qualities that make him an excellent attorney. He is a younger lawyer in comparison to many of the veterans in the area, but his expertise speaks through shrewd discernment, both in and outside the courtroom.

In retrospect, I know that employing a professional, well-versed attorney who gave honest legal advice was a valuable asset to me. My case only involved family law, but I would recommend Sam Bone in every area that he practices. My children and I are thankful for the Bone Law Firm.

I was in bad shape recovering from cancer and kidney failure when I was arrested.  They made me feel like I had nothing to worry about.  They treated me with respect even knowing I was homosexual and you do not get that in a lot of offices or businesses in Gadsden.  Sam is a winner guys.  He will go out of his way to help and set up a payment arrangement for you.  I could not have had a better Gadsden criminal lawyer.  Sam knows the laws.  Everytime I see him he tells me he is proud for me to see how well I am doing.  I am going for my degree in psychology and further to a doctrine. I added up my bills and I will be able to make the same payments on my own for 3 years to pay off my debt with no bankruptcy claim on my credit report. I gave them 75.00 of 335.00 to file my claim initially but once I figured out the previous information I called and told them I changed my mind. So nothing was ever filed. I went to obtain my 75.00 with my receipt which clearly stated that it was for filing, and they refused to issue my funds. They claimed it was for work done but no work took place. I will be talking with my family's attorney. It's only 75.00 but it's the principal that matters. They are in violation of misrepresentation of funds, a civil wrong and they need to experience consequences for their wrongful actions.

name: Cheri H
text:
My experience was horrible!  I could not get a response without having to call back more than once.  Sometimes, I even faxed, e-mailed and even sent a signature required letter.

When I signed the contract, I was told my property taxes for the year would be paid in the bankruptcy.  Now over 6 months after discharge of the bankruptcy, I find I owe almost $1000 in property taxes.  The property tax office indicated interest was being charged.  If the attorney had informed me of this, I could have been paying before, to avoid so much interest.

I realize Klimjack advertises a lot on TV.  That is why I hired them, because I saw them on TV.  I never saw Mr. Klimjack personally until the court date have I filed the bankruptcy.

I expected when I hired an attorney, that they would do as stated and make sure the debts we discussed were paid as indicated in my contract with them.  I was not told nor did I expect to still owe after I paid the bankruptcy over 5 years of $470 per month.

I recommend you look for another attorney and avoid the Klimjack firm.

text:
Attorney, Counselor, Friend

"Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference. " Winston Churchill

We wanted to work with David after reading all of his reviews. I have to say that he does live up to his reputation.

Just like you will hear, he does answer all your questions and returns all his calls. David will also want to be sure you are prepared and that you have a clear understanding of what is needed and what to expect.

There's no doubt that his job would be easier and his hours be shorter, if he wasn't so thorough but that doesn't seem to matter because David is much more concerned about doing things correctly, than quickly.

When you need help, when you need to be heard, when your not quite sure of all the rules, when your only getting the short answer, this is the person to call.

" No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another. " Charles Dickens

Thank you for all the long hours and providing all the long answers.

name: Daniel Mitchell
text:
From the moment I contacted Mr. Gatch through email late at night, I got a response immediately! When I finally met with  Mr. Gatch the next day I was still a little skeptical of his services but none the less I heard him out. I came to him with an extremely complicated case, and told him that I would not hire him unless if he could meet all of my demands which were very time constrained due to the nature of the emergency that I presented him with. He informed me of his experience and explained to me the course of action he would take with clear and specific details which made it easy to comprehend. He understood the seriousness of my consternation, and assured me that he would get to work right away.  Over the next couple of days I saw him in action, and began to realize that his reputation clearly precedes him. WITHIN 3 BUSINESS DAYS AFTER HIRING HIM, he accomplished all of my demands with personalized, flawless, and expedited results that worked out in my favor. Not only does he have a very high work ethic but he is also a master of his trade. He holds a level superiority in his field that delivers comfort to his clients through his knowledge, confidence, experience, and professionalism. Mr. Gatch understands the importance of networking with locals of various communities regardless of what county he's in. He maintains an image that gives him uncontested credibility that promotes favorability and popularity amongst citizens, peers, and judges alike. The sincerity of his character establishes a genuine rapport that connected with me on a fundamental level which most attorneys lack in these days to be honest. Mr. Gatch is a formidable man against the complexities of the law which places him in a league of his own against the competition, and I have to say... it really inspired me. His dependability, tact, integrity, loyalty, and bearing are just a few of the traits that I witnessed, and as a former Sergeant and combat veteran of the United States Marine Corps these are just a few of the traits that we live by to serve our country. His services are no different which are always in the best interest of the client. If you're looking for someone to deliver you results in regards to the law...Look no further because David Gatch is a person who goes above and beyond the call of duty.

And if you're wondering what the emergency of my case was...it was a petition for emergency custody of my daughter, and a motion to domesticate a foreign judgement from the state of California. Pay him the money, you won't regret it.

text: I hired Mr. Gatch to handle my Chapter 7 bankruptcy. The need to file for bankruptcy is a very painful, humiliating experience, and I was terrified and filled with shame. Without that, the experience would have been extremely traumatic and painful.  However, because of Mr. Gatch’s personal as well as professional qualities, it has been painless.  At every step of the way, I knew exactly what to expect.  He was ALWAYS available when I needed him to be.  I never felt ignored, abandoned, or forgotten.  Instead, I felt he was working for me and I was always on his radar.  I had never been in a courtroom before this experience, so had no idea what to expect.  However, Mr. Gatch prepared me by going through the process, and giving me information on what would happen, in great detail, and there were no surprises.  I felt completely at ease and confident, which would not have been the case had I had another attorney.  I always knew that Mr. Gatch was on my side, and I can’t express how important that has been to me during one of the hardest experiences I’ve ever been through.  I would hire him again without reservation, and strongly recommend his services to others.

name: Sherry Sharp
text:
I opened my deceased father's estate on the advice of ELG in order to receive benefits from his asbestosis claim I mailed them letters testamentary. I called ELG on a regular basis to check on status of claim. I was always told that there was an estate issue. Now, time has run out because my fathers estate has been closed, and ELG has claimed the right to administer the estate ad litem, and the processing of the estate has moved from Jefferson to Baldwin County.

I should have never spent the money, which I need, to open my dad's estate only to be ignored long enough for his estate to be closed. Seems there is no way to win with this group without paying/losing more money. My father would be so saddened to know that these benefits are not available to me. He died 3 1/2 years, and I have done all the right things, according to ELG. I guess if they ignore cases long enough, then they can step in, claim that there is no family representative, and take their cut. I think it is a racket.

resp.text: Hello Mrs Sharp,  I see payment is being processed by the asbestos trust funds. Please be patient we are close, we just need to wait for them to process the entire once and for all. Bare with us.

text: First off I would like to start off that I placed the phone call to them on Monday, and didn't retain Mrs. Kim until Wednesday. We had court on Friday. text: For the amount of trials and tribulations Shirley has went through, the hard work continues with her passion for law. I highly recommend this law firm and everyone in it.

name: David Plokhooy
text: Follow up to previous review.....  the lack of communication is only the tip of the iceberg.  Hired this firm to represent me in a contested divorce.  During the process the firm did absolutely nothing.  Never performed discovery, never contested improper behavior by the defendant, never answered calls or emails, never informed me of hearings or provided updates.  Worse, after doing nothing they quit (withdrew) days before the hearing having done nothing and leaving me with no representation -- despite providing all of my information to the defense.  It is pretty clear that even though I hired the firm they had no intention of providing service except to provide help to the defendants attorney as they requested information.  Beware this firm.  Dishonest, unethical, unprofessional and certainly won't represent you.  Prior complaints claim this firm was not helpful and the firm posted rather nasty responses saying they couldn't "legally" reply.  Don't believe that.  They couldn't reply because they really didn't provide any service and hid behind the "legal" argument.  If you want to throw away money to hire a lawyer to work against your interests Millwood is the right firm.  If you actually want professional representation, go anywhere else.

resp.text:
When I met with you, I immediately filed everything that needed to be filed to obtain an injunction on your behalf and obtained a Court date. I have proof I notified you of your court date. Your own actions caused a delay in the Court proceedings. I cannot divulge those publicly because I am bound by confidentiality requirements.  You accused me of ethical violations, which is blatantly false. I take my job very seriously. I also uphold every ethical duty and take it very seriously. As for paying money, I haven't been paid so you are blatantly false about getting nothing for your money. There is no money for you to get anything from. More than half of what you paid only covered the filing fee to the Court. I felt sorry for you and tried to help you and this is the thanks I get.
I personally sent you an email 5 business days before you posting your nasty review. My office staff, every single person at my office, spoke to you everyday for 4 business days, including the day you wrote the nasty review, informing you I was in trial. They helped you as much as they could. You have your answers,  you're just looking for someone to blame other than taking responsibility for your own actions.
I did not bail on you days before a Court date. As I explained to you, it is only a docket call, not a Court hearing.
Yes I have withdrawn because I will not tolerate someone making blatant untrue statements about my staff and me, which you have and continue to do.

name: Dana Buchanan
text: Great folks:) reasonable on obtaining services as well.

name: Donnie Kelley
text: Hard to communicate with the attorneys here and only by email which cost 15 dollars for every email sent to her then 15 more for the email she replies with. Wasn't well prepared for my hearing and didn't do well on my case for being so eager to settle.

resp.text: Donnie, I am shocked that you would say these things. I busted my tail for you and you can't deny it.  It's a shame I can not disclose the truth in order to defend myself from your accusations. However, I worked for pennies on the dollar because of a non paying client that wanted services for free.

name: Crystal Barnett
text: This was one of the best attorney that I have ever used, I will recommend her to anyone needing a good lawyer.

name: David Plokhooy
text:
Maybe a little early to post a review since I still have a divorce case in progress but thus far I've found communication is a significant problem.  Never get progress updates even when requested.  Other party continues to create havoc, steal assets and do unethical things that nobody can comprehend and even though reported to Millwood, nothing gets done.  It's possible the firm is working hard but it's impossible to know.  Clearly if communication matters to you you'll be disappointed.

Great to see the detailed yet completely false and fabricated response from Millwood.  I guess a couple simple questions to readers might clear everything up.  Anyone know the difference between a docket appointment and a docket hearing?  Anyone know the specific steps and procedures needed to file a discovery demand?  If you answered no, congratulations, you're not a lawyer, however, if you hired a lawyer to answer these questions make sure it isn't Shirley Millwood.  She will avoid answering anything unless she can hide behind lawyer speak.  So Shirley... Since you threw down the gauntlet.... courts intentionally complicate processes and hide behind verbiage most people don't know.  Although I've spent more years in college than any attorney I still can't comprehend the complex processes lawyers hide behind to try and make a JD seem worth more than a PHd.  You can cry and whine about how you and your staff "communicated".  How about you explain why you can't answer to "do I need to be there" or "what is the next step" is impossible for you.  Yes, contacting your office for four days seems excessive until you explain that you were being asked a simple question you refused to answer.  Bottom line here folks... Shirley Millwood is really good at doing nothing and hiding behind leagalese to explain why she can't be helpful.  Attorneys are America's most despised professionals and Shirley Millwood is a shining example if why.  Go anywhere else.  To Shirley directly.... I posted a review because neither you nor your staff would answer a simple question and you responded like an angry 10 year old.  You are a lawyer... Grow up.  Millwood deserves to fail unless you recognize you are not Superior to the people that pay you.  Good riddance, you'd have failed anyway (oh... I forgot to mention Shirley felt it was ok not to even look at my case details until one week before trial).  Learn your profession Shirley and you won't have to respond to negative reviews.

name: woolrose
text:
I am 70 years old and have never, until recently, sought the assistance of an attorney (except for developing a will or to review contracts before I signed) . I asked a relative, who used to work with the court system, to suggest a good law firm. My relative stated if I wanted an Honest and Reliable firm, I should contact Barfoot and Schoettker.

After making an appointment, I met with their associate, Jase Sayre and provided him with the paperwork. We discussed my case and Jase  explained all aspects of the procedure in detail. While working my case he kept me informed of the progress. He fully explained the options available to us and allowed me to chose which avenue I though best.
The result was he recovered a very significant amount (the full amount) of money owed to me.

I highly recommend the Barfoot and Schoettker Law firm. My case was solved in a quick and extremely efficient manner. The costs were very reasonable (no padding the books or intentional delays as I have heard that some law firms do). The interaction was always professional while also being personable and productive. Thank you Jase for your hard work and honest work ethic.

name: David Peel
text: Very pleased with the legal service provided by Ben Schoettker,. His genuine care and concern for his clients is a much-appreciated bonus. Would definitely recommend this firm.

name: Joan Beasley
text:
I highly recommend Barfoot & Schottker over all others.

With only a few months left before the two year deadline of my case, I contacted this firm to consider my case. (The attorney I initially hired had unexpectedly retired.)  Barfoot & Schoettker agreed to take my case even though they were working against a close deadline.

I was impressed with their care and compassion, close straight forward communication, integrity, diligence and professionalism. Jase and Kay  were diligent in keeping me informed about the case and including me in decisions that had to be made.

Overall it was a vey positive experience, and I would not hesitate to use them again.

text: Jim has been my attorney since 2015 and has been a huge asset to not only my family but to our business as well. I cannot say enough about him and his abilities. He was referred to me by another attorney which in itself speaks volumes. Pino & Associates will be our law firm for all our business and personal needs!

name: Tara Davenport
text:
In December 2015 Jim Pino was referred to me by a family friend, also an attorney and who’s advice and opinion matter greatly to me.

I needed an attorney who would fight for me. To help and advise me with a divorce after 23 years of marriage. I knew going into it that it wasn’t going to be anywhere close to pretty, much less easy for a multitude of reasons. But I also knew that I had “hit my wall” and it was necessary. I also knew that I was going to have to have an attorney that would work with me, not just for me. I had been married since I was 21.... nothing about anything was easy and I was terrified about everything.

And that’s exactly what Jim did for me.

Jim and his amazing staff helped me through one of the hardest times of my life and helped me find myself again.

I would and do, recommend Jim Pino & Associates to any and everyone who asks.

Thank you Jim and thank you to your awesome staff!!

name: Gordon Madden
text: There is not enough space to share my experience with Jim and the entire staff. They have worked with me for over a decade (11) years. Almost daily, many nights, weekends even when they've been on vacation. Never once failing to jump up to the emergency, or simply to make sure my son was protected. Because of Jim and his family, staff and associates, I have been given the opportunity to have a wonderful relationship with my little boy. He's stood in my defense against 17 different lawyers, sometimes 5 against 1. His son has stood with me as well. We've had multiple trials, most recently he postponed major surgery and suffered through a 4 day trial. Agonizing in Pain against 4 very reputable lawyers. Not to mention, he did this for 1/5 of the money the other guys were being paid. He did it because he cares and felt that it was in my son's best interest and we'll being. Just today, our order was issued. Once again, his hard work and character and one of a kind skill prevailed. I still have sole custody and I am assured a meaningful relationship with the most important thing in my life. I can never repay Jim for his decade long dedication to making sure we're protected. If you need help, a brief visit with him will reveal the true character and heart he puts into making sure justice prevails. My name is Gordon Madden and I would be happy to share my story with you.

name: Jeremy Naish
text: Mr. Pino went above and beyond to help me. He explained everything very thoroughly and let me know what to expect. He was honest and gave me options. I have used Mr. Pino on a few occasions with success every time. I highly recommend using Mr.Pino.

name: Dorothy Smith
text: One of the dishonest law firm any person can get they are fake. I hired them to handle my immigration case concerning my husband to be a permanent citizen in the United States. I call them after I got referred from David Clark whose law firm is in Prattville Alabama.  The secretary told me David Clark has retired from practicing. She gave me the number to get in touch with olmond hall to handle my immigration case  after chatting with them over the phone and Thea Hall who happened to be the lawyer wife told me she handle all immigration paperwork. She told me to fax her my case from the Embassy of Ghana that following Monday and I fax her the denied letter from the Embassy of Ghana.  She told me to call them back to give me a quote on the charges that next week. She told me it was gonna cost me 2 thousand dollars to help me get my husband here in the States. I gave them the money. Immigration gave me 30 days to reply the denied letter from the Embassy of Ghana.  After those 30 days I'm thinking that the law firm had send in my evidence to support my case I get a letter from immigration stating that they revoke my case because I haven't replied the NOIR letter from the Embassy of Ghana. The law firm took my money and send nothing to immigration to help me out with my immigration case.  I filed a complaint with Alabama State Bar against the law firm and to make matters worse they lied out of giving me back my money. I advised whoever choose this law firm to handle a case to get a real lawyer who gonna be honest and true to you . This law firm don't do nothing but take people money and lie.

text: Absolutely can not reach him.  My company paid him to give my wife and I a living will, death will, and POA.  I have only received one and it has marks through it so guessing not fully legal.  Even after meeting my wife and I on 2 separate occasions at 1 appointment(there because he said it was all ready) he handed my wife and I divorce paperwork to fill out and walked off.  Had to chase him down once we realized how wrong he was.  My company paid him in March.  It is now October and still not done.  I have to call him every time.  So far have called him 4 times this week with no response.  Horrible lawyer.  Wouldn't use him ever again!  It shows how attention to detail he is.  Google still has him in Hoover.  He moved downtown at least 6 months ago, but he has no clue!!!

name: Aneesh Chand
text: Highly unethical attorney. We chose Tim since he was  a member of our legal plan to represent us in a civil case. After telling us that the plan would not cover our case, we paid Tim a $2500 retainer. During this time Tim would be proactive and mail us copies of whatever documents he would send or file with the courts. I looked over our legal plan and found that his charges should have, in fact, been covered by our plan.Our legal plan's counse determined that this was so and advised Tim of the same. Since being notified that his time would be covered by the plan and  to not use my retainer for covered charges, I stopped getting any correspondence from his office. No copies of any documents,  no phone calls, no more updates, nothing. Tim never even told us that there was a hearing for summary judgement. The  only reason we found out was from a copy of the order from the  court, itself.  After the hearing, we found out that Tim didn't even argue our case as we had discussed. We eventually lost our case. Tim didn't even bother to notify us until over a week later. When asked about our options, Tim determined that he no longer wanted to represent us and referred us to another attorney who wouldn't even return our calls. When asked about the refund of the $2500 retainer, Tim put us off for over 6 weeks until he finally acknowledged he was trying to "come up" with the money. Our legal plan counsel had also been contacting him to return our retainer without further delay. Throughout this time and during our case Tim would never initiate contact with us. We had to initiate contact with him. Even then, it would take anywhere from a week and a half to a month before he would respond.  Tim eventually decided after 46 days that he was no longer going to refund our money despite knowing that his charges were covered by our plan. I have yet to get a breakdown of how my retainer was spent, much less anything else. I would never refer him to anyone. Now he is running for circuit court judge. If Tim is representative of our judicial and legal system, then we, as citizens, have very little when it comes to faith in our legal system.

name: Brad Horton

text: I am so very thankful for Attorney Bob Galloway for finding some very vital information that spared me from making a terrible decision regarding a Special Needs Trust I manage. You are an attorney with great integrity.

name: Christopher Slater
text:
Called them to see if they would be able to help with my case and was told by the receptionist it wasn't something they would handle. Which is ok I understand. So I asked her what type of attorney do I need to call? She responded, "I'm just a receptionist, I'm not here for free legal advice." Which then I told her I wasn't asking for legal advice, I was just wondering if you could point me in the right direction. She then responded.. " sir I'm not going to argue with you.....
I interrupted her there and said " what do you mean argue with you?" .... then she hung up on me.

I just don't understand how people that work in a professional setting such as this has the nerve to treat a potential customer. Maybe my case isn't for you this time, but what about the next? You just scratched yourself off that list. You could have easily asked someone in the office what type of attorney could help me. I'm sorry you hate your job so much. I would to if all I did was answer the phone all day.

name: Kathryn McCown
text: Chris didn't just win my case; it was a complete annihilation. Not only did I retain custody of my grandaughter, but he also got me an order for child support that I didnt even ask for. He is also very friendly and approachable. I met him in an elevator at the courthouse and then asked some of the clerks about him. They all knew him and had great things to say about him. That is one of the reasons I chose him.. I didnt want a lawyer who stays in his cushy office all day. I wanted someone who is in the courthouse fighting for his clients. I highly recommend Chris! Oh, and I just saw that some guy left bad feedback because he said Chris charges an initial consult fee. I dont know if that is true, but my initial consultation was in an elevator. I was at the courthouse because I was planning to fight it myself to save legal fees. After we got off the elevator, chris talked with me for at least a half hour and told me exactly what to do to file it myself. After talking with him and hearing his incredibly reasonable price, I was so relieved to be able to afford him and not have to do it myself. I had spoken with another attorney that morning, and he wanted almost ten times the price, which is why I had decided to do it myself. So, the implication that Chris is money hungry is just not true in my experience. (I actually came back and edited my review after reading what that guy wrote). Even if he does charge an initial fee (I dont know), it would be worth it, because I guarantee you will walk out of his office knowing exactly the best course of action, and that kind of peace of mind is priceless.

text: My wife filled a suite with this attorney several years ago. They have done nothing but deceive and lie ever since. From day one she has asked them several times if the suit they were filing was a class action suit. They kept telling her no. Well, they were not lying completely however they lead her to believe they were filing the suit only on her behalf. When, in actuality it was an ultra-massive tort suit. None of this is what really upsets me, what upsets me is that from day one they have lead her believe that she is going to receive a minimum of $2,000,000. I have done several hours of research getting the background on the lawsuits filed for the same reason she filed hers. First off I have not even seen the name Cory Watson Attorneys mentioned in any of the reports. Secondly there appears to be over 10,000 people file suite for the same exact reason, against the same exact company, with several law firms. The litigation for this particular devise has been going on for many years. And, it would appear by all indications she will probably never be paid one penny. To this day, they never contact her, if she contacts them they tell her they expect some kind of payout soon, and they are still insisting that it will be $2,000,000+ Why would they cntinue to lie to her? What possible benifit would they get out of it?

I called today and felt I received a runaround excuse that there waiting on more funds to come in ! My mother would still be here if it were not for Valley Products and there asbestos product ( car gaskets ) ! My father deserves this settlement he lives month to month and money doesn’t compensate for losing my mom but it would ease my dads financial burden after the loss of my mom !

name: Ari Miller
text: By far, the best, most knowledgeable, and effective attorney in the region. He does not sugar coat. He does not give best case scenario. He is honest and very accurate in his assessment of situations. He is highly regarded among his peers, opponents, and judges, and he fights the right fights. If you want an attorney that will promise you the world, take your money, and fail, he's not your guy. But, if you want someone who understands the complexities of human behavior, the law, and how to best represent his clients, Joel is the one. Do not waste time or money anywhere else. Joel's clients always achieve the best possible outcomes. Always. I recommend him unconditionally. But when you see him, be honest, don't expect him to coddle you and make you feel warm and gooey about yourself, and then just trust him to handle things. That's it.

text: Overall, not a very good experience at all. This attorney will talk up a good game at the initial consultation, then will subsequently reveal that is not even on your side, which is the very least one ought to expect from a defense attorney. Don't expect him to actually remember anything about your case, because he never takes notes and seems to have terrible comprehension skills. I would describe him as incompetent, but it actually seemed worse than incompetence: he didn't believe me and he was deferring to the prosecutor's (his opponent) side. Though there clearly was some incompetence at play. Mr. Sogol told me that if I got into a pre-trial diversion program that my record would be expunged after completing it. However, I looked it up and the alleged offense for which I was arrested CANNOT be expunged under Alabama law, though I plan to litigate that issue when the time is right. If you want an attorney who will make a serious effort to learn about the intricacies of your case, I highly advise you to look elsewhere.

name: Natalie Schibell, MPH
text: I would give no stars if I could as I have made three calls over the course of two weeks seeking representation without a response. The answering service used is either not recording messages or the attorneys are being selective. I realize my matter is a small one; however, a return phone call within a reasonable amount of time is the bare minimum expectation this firm could not meet. I have worked in a prominent law firm for nearly a decade and know the value of customer service with every client, both large matters and small. I unfortunately cannot use that law firm as I moved a great distance away. Parkman and White, please return your phone calls, whether you can take the case or not. No firm is too big or an attorney too important to make a courtesy return call or email, at a minimum. You can even have your staff perform the task for you. This way a potential client cannot waste additional time and effort and can call someone else who cares enough to provide the service.

text: We hired Parkman and White after my husband was accused of a crime that could have landed him in jail for many years. He had done nothing wrong and unfortunately in our world of technology a computer virus was almost our undoing. We were told that if we wanted the best we should hire Parkman and White. We met Jim Parkman face to face a couple of times and though I did not have the pleasure of meeting William White, I had numerous phone conversations with him. They worked diligently to clear my husband's name. It took almost two years but the night before we were to go to court Mr. White called to inform us that all charges had been dropped. They fought to prove his innocence and I am so thankful that we were sent their way. Mr. Parkman and Mr. White definitely lived up to their reputation of being the best. If you have a legal issue I would highly recommend you get in touch with their law firm.

I was contacted by the regional director a  couple days before July 4th, saying she'll contacted me after the holiday to discuss compensation. Never called.

So after waiting for months to be compensated, I was told on Tuesday by front desk staff that the regional director(robin) said they will not be compensating me for items stolen by their staff. While I'm still getting emails from Amazon etc that my devices are being used. I just filed a lawsuit.

5 Jan 2015, UPDATE:  Our son has been placed at "Restoration Ranch", and seems to be doing great.  This was all made possible by many prayers and Mr. Matt Balch 100% support with the Madison City Judge and PO; Madison County Jail and PO;  Morgan County Jail and PO.  This has been a heavy demanding case,  Mr. Balch stuck with  our family and during this last court date convinced Judge Smith and many other official folks to give our son one more chance.  Praise the Lord for Matthew Balch!

My son has been in and out of jail many times with DUIs, robbery, etc.,  all these charges have been linked to the illiness of "alcohol addiction".  Mr. Balch was appointed to our son by the court from his first arrest and done outstanding work supporting him before the judges and patrol officers on all charges.  Mr. Balch believes in our son and the capability he has of becoming an outstanding member of society when he gets rid of this addiction.  We are praying for healing by way of a good rehabilition center and the "Grace of God". .

name: Billy L Billings Jr
text:
My dad passed away intestate and has a house in Alabama. I live in Orlando, FL and was trying to find an attorney in Alabama to assist me with his affairs there. So, I found Attorney Pierce online and reached out to him. His staff was very nice and very pleasant on the phone.

During my phone consultation with Attorney Pierce, he was equally as nice and very personable. He asked me some questions about the circumstances and was very attentive.

Finally, what really impressed me about him was that once he realized that my dad's house was not close to where he typically practices; he advised me that I would most likely be better served to consult an attorney that was closer to my dad's house. He said that he could handle the case; however, it would become more expensive because that area is approximately 4 hours from him. In my opinion, most people wouldn't even care about that. They would only care about running the bill up on you. In addition to that, he even found and referred me to an attorney in that area that could assist me.

I certainly appreciate his honesty and his assistance. I wish that I could've had that opportunity to work with him in my time of need. Take care, Attorney Pierce, and thank you very much. It was truly a pleasure.

resp.text: Thank you so much! I really appreciate the kind words. Our goal is always to try to help folks the best we can, even if that means sending them to friends who may be a better fit for the case based on the facts or location. I hope things are always well for you in Orlando. -KDP

Kyle was a horrible lawyer. It took weeks for him to get back to us at times. We asked 4 times for emergency custody to be filed, he filed twice. It took 14 months just to get visitation set up because his priorities are all over the place. We had to do most of the information work for him. $3K, and all we have to show for it is minimal visitation. We haven't even received our receipts for the work done, and it's been 9 months. I wouldn't recommend him to anyone.
If I could give 0 stars, I would.

resp.text: Hi Kat, We're bound from making statements that would disclose confidential information regarding a client matter. However, that doesn't sound like anything we would've done. While we have no control over court dockets, sometimes causing cases to take longer that anybody would like, we generally provide client updates every 30 to 45 days and have an always available CaseStatus app for around the clock updates. Reach out to us on the office number at 256-399-9470 so we can get to the bottom of your issues. -Kyle

resp.text: I hate that you appear to have had a bad experience. We have a policy of sending notification letters and text messages to all clients as soon as possible after a court date is set while returning all phone calls within the next business day. You may also be interested to know that we just started a trial of a 24-hour, 365 days-a-year service to ensure every phone message is received by a live person. Legal Ethics prohibit me from discussing any specifics on a forum like this, but I'd love for you to call the office at 256-399-9470 so we can discuss your specific situation.

Legal Ethics prohibit us from providing any information through a public forum such as this, or to family members, since that could affect the client's case.

However, I can say that our policy for all cases, whether retained or appointed, is to provide a status update letter or other notification to all clients no less than every 45 days. Additionally, we provide all clients with access to our 24/7 Case Status portal so information is always available.

text: Chris was a fantastic lawyer! My husband had went through a custody case with an attorney from Ft Payne the previous year and lost due to her lack of interest in trying to lift a finger at all. My husband lost a case that should have been an easy win. After that, we were afraid to try to fight for custody again, even though we knew we had to get his kids out of the situation they were in. We finally had the last straw, and contacted Chris. He really showed us that some lawyers really do actually try, and work their hardest for their customers. He went through ever single thing we brought him, whether it be, pictures, text messages, talking to family and any one willing to testify for us, subpoenaing unpaid bills, police records... I mean, he WORKED and built an excellent case for us. I will say that one of the girls that is office staff was not very interested in her job, and hung up the phone on me, but I would not judge the lawyer by that one staff member. He really is an excellent attorney and will work for the money you pay him. And all of the other staff members are absolutely fantastic, especially Jamie! She even asked how my step daughters were doing and would say she had been thinking about them when we would have to go to their office. She really cared, and that means a lot when you have to be a situation like we were. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

name: Amy Parrish
text: My son hired Margret Casey to handle visitation of his daughter, he gave her permission to talk directly to me because of his work schedule and he referred to me for help. First, after we settled with Mom on visitation and ect.. we got the paper work and she had omitted an entire year of child visitation, she filed to have it corrected and filed it wrong, then we discovered she omitted another VERY important agreement that was made between them. I emailed her about it and she told me to email the Mom's attorney (unprofessional), I did so and copied her. A few days past and I never heard anything back so I emailed her again, she then told me it was not on the agreement made between them and sent the paper work I had sent her and the Mom's attorney. I told her I was confused, it was at the bottom right of the 2nd page, to which she replied oh I see now-ok, I will get an amendment filed. The next day, I asked her if she had reached out to Mom's attorney and she replied: Respectfully, there is no need to send ongoing emails, she said she would only communicate with my son going forward. She never even said she was sorry for messing up the papers 3 separate times. When we hired her, I explained that we knew we were not her only clients but this was very important to us. At first things seemed ok but once I paid the final bill and we discovered she left stuff out of the papers her attitude changed. When you make a mistake you apologize for the mistake and correct it, not make the client feel guilty for asking for it to be corrected.In addition to all of this, we were having my son added to the birth certificate, Margret told us to give it 2 months after the judge signed off on it and we could just get a copy at the Health Dept, when my son went to get it Vital Records had the birth certificate on hold because "our attorney" did not pay the $49.50 fee to have it changed nor were we EVER told about the fee. It took him 3 hours to get it straightened out. I would NOT recommend her to ANYONE. Respect goes both ways. When we met with her, I told her I knew we were not her only clients but this was VERY important to us. WE both felt disrespected, ignored, and treated unprofessional!

resp.text:
Ms. Parrish,

I am sorry you were not happy with my communication during my representation of your son.  While I do believe that we were able to attain the goals that your son set for the outcome of his court case, I appreciate you for pointing out that I exhibited a lack of respect for you. This was not intentional; in fact, I respect you very much.

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your experience. I will use your comments to improve upon the way I listen to my clients and work to better understand what lies at the foundation of my client’s issues.

Margaret Casey

resp.text: When our firm gets involved in a legal matter, we strive to do the best job that we can for our client. text: First visit I was very nervous going in. After sitting down with Russell he made me very comfortable. He laid everything out on the table for me and told me what he could do. I had a pending felony charge that will now be expunged from my record! Look no further, I highly recommend Russell and his amazing staff to help you! Best wishes! Thanks Russell!!!

resp.text: Well, God Bless you for those sweet words, Kindra. The first half of your comments represents my favorite part of my job - providing hope and reassurance. It was obvious to me that he is well liked and, more importantly, well respected in the legal community. Again, I highly recommend Mr. Crumbley and will never forget what he did for me.

text:
Chris F.

I was arrested nearly 2 years after a bar fight for felony assault, had never been arrested before and both a family friend and the bail bondsman recommended Crumbley-Blackwell. I hired Mr. Crumbley as my lawyer and he did everything he could. They tried to get me to take a plea for a misdemeanor and 2 years probation and Mr. Crumbley easily could of just told me to take it, as he was already paid and could of dumped me off and move on, but he insisted we take it to trial because he thought wasn't right what was happening and i never should of been arrested or charged for defending myself when I was attacked. He believed we could win and so I went with his advice. In the end right before the trial he got all charges dismissed and even court fees waived and I just had to pay a small restitution fee. Hiring Mr. Crumbley was the best decision I could have made and am extremely thankful to him and his firm for everything. Hopefully I never have any use for him again but if I'm ever in a bad way again he'll definitely be my first call.

name: JW Wryta
text: I am a male 37 year old honor discharged protected veteran who holds a Masters Degree and has never had any issues with the law prior to my DUI in 2017.  While my charges were from 2017, I was not arrested until 2019 because I was sent to the hospital on the date of the offense instead of jail and diagnosed with Sudden Traumatic Shock exasperated by alcohol.  Being arrested was completely out of the norm for me.  I did not know where to begin, what to expect, and was consistently imagining the worst possible outcomes and scenarios.  Based off my charges, my bail agent highly recommended that I contact Mr. Crumbly for counsel.  I had an initial meeting with Mr. Crumbly within a week from the first time I contacted him.  The initial meeting did not take longer then an hour and during that time Mr. Crumbly was able to explain all my available options to include representation options, payment options, court expectations, and expected timelines.  Perhaps the most beneficial thing Mr. Crumbly discussed in the initial meeting was the overall stress of the situation.  He told me that it was human nature to imagine the worst possible outcomes and to not worry about that as it was him and his teams job to make sure those outcomes don’t happen.  He was absolutely right and ,during the entire course of my case, I constantly imagined the worst possible scenarios; however, I always made myself think back to that initial conversation with Mr. Crumbly and remembered that is why he is there.  After that initial meeting, Mr. Crumbly and his team handled everything for 6 months up until my court date with the Judge.  Before I even had to go before the Judge, Mr. Crumbly had secured a deal with the DA for me to enter the Pre-Trial Intervention Program (PTIP) and have charges dropped following the completion of the program.  I was more than happy to enter PTIP as it took all uncertainty and stress off the table and I was able to hold everything going forward in my own hands.  As of May 2020, I have successfully completed the PTIP program and am currently working with Mr. Crumbly on having my charges expunged.  I am very pleased with the services I have received from Mr. Crumbly and his team and would highly recommend them.  While I am not going to put personal information on here for obvious reasons, Mr. Crumbly has my full permission to give my number to prospective clients who would like a recommendation.

name: Greg Kaltz
text:
TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN-

In March of 2014 I was charged with a DUI in Madison County, Alabama. This led to several serious concerns I had as to what negative impacts this DUI might have regarding maintaining my current place of employment, a valid Alabama Driver’s License, and the potential for increased auto insurance rates. In addition, I was uninformed of all the specific issues pertaining to Alabama State Law as they apply to a DUI charge especially, with respect to possible fines, imprisonment, unknown future adverse impacts, or establishment of an unfavorable permanent criminal history. The level of stress in my daily life was extremely high, to say the least, due to this situation and these concerns.

I was referred to the Law Office(s) of Russell W. Crumbley to try and sort all these issues out. Russell put me immediately at ease and clarified for me, in a no-nonsense way, what needed to be done to effectively address the DUI charge against me. He also kept me informed as to the current status of my case as it made its way through the Alabama judicial process and provided reassuring personal representation at any and all court scheduled hearings or appointments. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND retaining Russell as your DUI Attorney should you ever find yourself in a similar situation. He is a completely knowledgeable and competent attorney in the area of Alabama DUI Criminal Law and you can rest assured that he will obtain the best possible outcome regarding your case.

Sincerely Yours-

Greg Kaltz

P.S. – Due to Russell’s expertise, he obtained a DISMISSAL of the DUI charges against me! He is also handling a follow-on expungement action for me that will clear my Alabama arrest record for DUI.

resp.text: Greg: It was a pleasure. Thank you! ~ Russell

name: Brock Grayson
text: Mr. Russell Crumbley took good care of my DUI case and was an expert in all things considered. He took the stress out of my hands and life and handled everything in a professional manner. On a Sunday, he was the only office that took my phone call, I had to be at court the next day after my arrest at 8 AM. Every office was closed, including Crumbley's. However, on his website there was a chat option in which he took my request and talked to me personally. On that very Sunday he met with me within an hour. He was on his way back from Tuscaloosa and still met with me! I've never been so stressed, but after meeting with Mr. Crumbley, he assured me I would be taken care of. The results: My case was nolle prossed: thrown out. All I had to do was sit back, and relax while Russ took care of the rest. If you want positive results, do yourself and stress level a favor and call his office and have him represent you. You will not regret it.

resp.text: Thank you, Brock, not only for those kind words but also for letting us handle your case. We consider it an honor and a privilege to work with every client that gives US that opportunity. There are options in this town. We tend to appreciate those people who choose us. Again, THANK YOU! ~ Russell

name: Refinnej
text:
Mr. Crumbley has been extremely helpful a couple times for me.  His office has been helpful and detail oriented to ensure that we knew everything that was going on and kept me up to date every step of the way.  They were always friendly and accommodating.  Even while not representing me, he was able to give me some great advice about my father's will and estate after my father had passed away.  He took the time out of his busy day to tell me what I needed to do and who it would be that I needed to find and contact once it went to probate.  This is not his area of expertise, he was just helping me know where to start.  He explained to me the process.   Since it was a large city that my father lived in, it was a while before the estate went to probate and I assumed I had been written out due to my father's controlling sister so I didn't bother looking into it until 2 years later when I was found by a life insurance company and received a letter explaining that I was the beneficiary of a policy.  I then took Mr. Crumbley's advice by finding the attorney through the probate court and found that I had many savings bonds, which the sister told me had been spent 10 years prior.  The executrix allegedly told the attorney that she tried to contact me, but she did not  Thanks to these cushions I have been able to go back to school.

I want to add, if anyone is in legal trouble, please seek counsel.  The DA will lie straight to your face.  The DA will threaten you with the highest jail terms to get you to plead guilty so they don't have to take it to trial.  Their in house legal assistants that are there to help guide defendants will tell you that if you don't take the plea "deal" that you wont win.  They are only there to help the DA, not you.  It's very difficult, especially when it's your word against law enforcement officers, many who have no problem lying in court and they're buddies with the judge.  You need someone who knows the law and knows how the courts work.  It wont be free, but it's worth it to not have to go to jail and/or have a record haunting you.  For more serious crimes, you may get a public defender, but your life is on the line with someone who may not care about you or what happens to you.  It's a dangerous risk to take and once you are convicted, it's harder to find people to listen to you.

resp.text: How kind of you. Thank you. What a mountain of burden you had going on in your life. Thanks for letting us help you navigate through it. ~ Russell

text: I hired Mr. Crumbley to help out with a pretty scary issue where I had made incredibly dumb mistakes from lack of judgment and maturity. I was worried I would lose everything, my family and my future (and I almost did) but Crumbley got me sorted out, reassured and sealed after just a couple of meetings. I wish he had been a bit cheaper and that this all never happened, but Mr. Crumbley made me feel a whole lot better while he worked. I’d hire him again, 100 percent.

resp.text: LOL! Everyone wishes lawyers were cheaper. Even lawyers when they are on the hiring end and we are ALL on that end from time to time. And, even "mature" people make mistakes so don't kick yourself. Things turned out great for you so learn from it. And, THANK YOU for your comments. ~ Russell

text: My husband went for a consultation about some legal issues and the lawyer he spoke with would not listen and just dismissed him without knowing all the information. I would NEVER recommend this firm to anybody.

resp.text: Sara: I am sorry you and/or your husband do not feel like he got heard the way he  should have been heard. I take it from your comment that you were not at the consultation. In either event, I would invite you and/or your husband to reach out to me via email (russ@crumbleylaw.com). Leave me a number and I will personally call you and/ or your husband at my very earliest opportunity. You certainly may come to the office but I am offering to make this as easy as possible for you. I am here for either, or both, of you. I will make sure your husband is heard. I will make sure he knows he is heard. I don't know if he has an issue we can help him with but, if we can't, I will make sure he understands that and I will make sure he understands why. If we can't help but I know someone who can I will give him a name and number of that lawyer. I am here to help - not frustrate. Thank you for your time. ~ Russell Crumbley

name: Cheryl Mellema
text:
Mr. Crumbley’s office called me the day after I posted my review of his partner, and asked if I would speak with Mr. Crumbley at his office. When I explained I was busy I was asked if I would speak with him over the phone. I agreed and I was transfered to Mr. Crumbley.  After listening to me explain my why I left the review and my account of my interactions with Mr. Matt Wisda, Mr. Crumbley asked me several questions.
1. Would I consider removing my review?
2. Would I consider moving it to Mr. Wisda’s webpage?
3. If he (Crumbley) were to fire Mr. Wisda would I then delete my review! I said no.
4. Was there ANYTHING he (Crumbley) could say or do that would result in me removing the review? To which I responded “Not ethically”, because I felt he was trying to “lead me” into asking for a monetary resolution.

During our discussion Mr. Crumbley stated he was not at all happy about Mr. Wisda’s conduct. And that he was considering actions (including termination).  He asked once more if there was anything he could do To get me to retract the review against “Crumbley, Blackwell, & Wisda Lawfirm”.  I explained to him that when I researched Divorce Attorneys/Firms I based my decision in part on the reviews of his Firms website and information regarding the lawyers and therefore would not consider removing the review. We said goodbye and I hung up.

I spent that day wondering if he would call again. I just knew “IT” wasn’t over.
So this evening I checked on my review out of curiosity...and wouldn’t you know it there is this long drawn out explanation that it was I who was misinformed etc.  Never once mentioning any unethical behavior on behalf of Mr. Wisda!
I want to SHOUT from the highest rooftops what a sleazy slimeball you are! Shall I post more? Shall I post information Mr. Wisda freely disclosed to me about a clearly VERY SENSITIVE divorce and custody battle where the children involved had been...!
You disgust me!

I retained Matt Wisda to represent me for my divorce.  I feel he acted unethically.
I contacted his office after receiving an invoice for services that were not rendered. When I followed up with an appointment a few days later not only did he begin by talking about another case he had been working on (this was the 2nd time he mentioned details of this other party's case!) but he also presented me with an official Settlement Agreement" that clearly stated me and my spouse had both agreed to - WHICH NEITHER OF US HAD!

We never went through discovery at all! No mediation - nothing!
The entire document looked copy and pasted, and all of the assets and then some were to be awarded to me!

Mr. Wisda was trying to fool me into thinking he had been hard at work on my case and that I was entitled to everything when in fact he hadn't done anything. Additionally It was never my intention to try take my husband to the proverbial cleaners. I just wanted a fair settlement.

I didn't even look at the "Settlement Agreement" he'd drawn up while at his office. I had already decided to sever our business agreement and told him so.  I asked when I could pick up my remaining retainer and he said it would be about a week.

When I went to pick up the monies, enclosed with my check was an invoice of almost $700 for the bogus "Settlement Agreement" that had been drawn up without consultation or discovery.  Coincidentally the new invoice showed just one line item for the preparing of said agreement which was dated after the phone call I mentioned above.

I immediately drew up a letter refusing to pay and insisting I be refunded.  Additionally in the letter I called him out for trying to fool me and get paid for it. I emailed this letter and received a response early the next morning stating they would immediately refund the that money, which they did.

I am leaving this review to make others aware.  In our consultation meeting he told me his practice "is like a game to me."  And because  conducting his business in such a way, I feel, is an abuse of his power as an attorney and is extremely unethical.

resp.text:
We deeply regret that your experience with our office did not meet your expectation. We work very hard to not let that happen. Having said that, you say that you received a “settlement agreement” that indicated you and your husband had agreed to the settlement terms when, in fact, you had not agreed. You also say that this agreement was put together without doing any “discovery” or any “mediation”. You initially hired Mr. Wisda to assist you in negotiating an uncontested divorce with your husband’s lawyer. In fact, you produced, for us, a “settlement agreement” created by your husband’s lawyer when you hired Mr. Wisda. That settlement agreement had already been prepared absent any “discovery” or attempt to “mediate”. It was clearly the intentions of both parties (and their lawyers) to settle this matter, if possible, without costly litigation. This type divorce typically does not involve “discovery” (in the traditional sense) and most certainly doesn’t involve “mediation”. In these type matters we simply go with settlement negotiations to the extent we are able, which necessarily includes “settlement proposals”. Also, in this type situation, both parties tend to agree that they know what the assets are and their values are not in dispute.

The “settlement agreement” your husband’s attorney prepared, and gave you, was just like the one Mr. Wisda gave you. In reviewing your husband’s proposal it is noted that it also includes language stating that the two of you “acknowledged and agreed” to things that you had not already agreed upon. In other words, both lawyers settlement agreements included the very same language in that regard. In fact, most paragraphs in all settlement agreements are full of language such as “the parties acknowledge and agree …”. This language is included to satisfy legal requirements and applies to you ONLY AFTER you have actually read it, agreed to it and signed it. It is not intended to mean that you have already seen it and agreed to it. And, it is NEVER INTENDED to deceive. Your attorney, Matt Wisda, did exactly what your husband’s lawyer did with respect to that language.

As far as the “attempt to fool you” is concerned: you received an itemized statement of the charges. You received two billing statements. The second of those two seems to be where you objected. That statement involves the “settlement agreement”. You were dissatisfied with that charge and objected to that bill and, although you had NOT notified him of your desire to terminate him until after that work was done, we refunded every penny to you of that part of the bill. And your objection, as much as any we can tell, is founded on your belief that it included the “bogus” settlement language indicating that you and your husband had agreed to the terms that you had not agreed to.

We strive to handle cases the way our clients direct us. And, while the services you received were not satisfactory to you, Mr. Wisda DID NOT bill you for services not rendered. His conduct was not unethical. His ability to communicate effectively with you, I will agree, must have missed the mark. For example, we are not sure how, exactly, you did not understand that the “acknowledged and agreed” language in the settlement agreement did not mean you had both already agreed to that agreement. That was no more the intent of what Mr. Wisda provided you than it was the intent of what your husband’s attorney provided him. It was merely two lawyers doing their jobs and adding the language that was going to be necessary at some point, in advance. Perhaps THAT is why it looked copied and pasted.

We would encourage ANYONE who is dissatisfied in ANY way, with ANYONE in our office, to meet with any of us. WE ARE ALWAYS AVAILABLE to meet with that person and do everything we can to alleviate their concern and fight for your cause. Your case matters to us. And, YOU matter to us. Best wishes moving forward during this trying time.

~ Russell Crumbley & Matt Wisda

name: Jonathan Russell
text: I came to Mr. Crumbley with a domestic violence case in Huntsville VS me. I am an aerospace engineer here in Huntsville, and, like many of you, hold a security clearance. These charges HAD to get dropped if I had any hope of keeping my clearance and my job. I had never been in any trouble before so I wasn't sure how to go about things when the public defender asked me how I wanted to plea.. she told me to plea guilty and pay the county for a class that may or may not get the charges dropped. After getting some much needed advice from a kind correctional officer outside, I declined that plea and decided to plea not-guilty and seek out my own legal counsel. I found Mr. Crumbley's office and the charges ended up being dropped/dismissed. Him and his team, even the front office, they were all excellent. Couldn't have asked for a better outcome. Now my life, my clearance and my job will remain in tact. Everyone has the blurb at the end of their advertisements saying "no representation is made that the quality of legal services performed is greater than that of other lawyers" but I'm not sure I agree with that. Mr. Crumbley really knows what he's doing and takes the time to understand where your coming from, what you are trying to do, and came up with a fantastic plan to get me there. Thanks again, to the whole office and team at Crumbley, Blackwell, Wisda and Asc.

resp.text: Wow! Thank you Jonathan for those VERY KIND words. You were very fortunate to have gotten some really good, free, advice before you even met us. You did yourself a HUGE favor in following that advice. Thank you for choosing us to represent you. It was an honor to see you through this difficulty and it was especially gratifying to us considering how easily this could have turned out differently for you. Best wishes moving forward. ~ Russell

Some sessions we would just talk for hours about how to successfully overcome the stress and obstacles of life. Mr. Crumbley made a profound impact on my life. One I will forever be grateful for. Thank you Mr Crumbley for my mulligan in life.

resp.text: JD: Thank you! I wish I could sufficiently articulate how this review makes me feel. I often reference the "mulligan" that you reference. It is a simple concept that is most often applied on the golf course. But, as are many other simple sporting analogies, it is a great metaphor for life. I like to think such things are helpful. Your reference to it certainly makes me think it meant something to you as well. Here's hoping you "hit 'em long and straight" from here on out. ~ Russell

text: Contacted them trying to get help in resolving debt with a collection agency. Was dismissed very quickly and told there's not much an attorney could do and to pay the debt.

resp.text: Chuck: I very much appreciate your considering our firm to assist you with your issues. We do every thing we can to make ourselves available to people who wish to hire us to handle their legal issues. There are, however, occasions when people do not wish to hire us (for one reason or another) or even schedule an appointment to come meet with us. Under those scenarios, our staff gives the best information they can (given the limited engagement over the phone) to help them resolve their own issues. Other than that, there is very little an attorney can do for that person. If you feel you have been dealt with less than fairly I would invite you to communicate your concerns with me by emailing me directly at russ@crumbleylaw.com. Leave your phone # and I will be glad to call you and see if I can give you a better answer than the answer you received earlier this week. I can assure you that you will feel much differently after we speak. Either way, have a good day and best wishes with you issues. ~ Russell Crumbley

Do yourself a favor and make sure you hire him to take care of yourself because I’d honestly be hesitant to have anybody else to represent me in a potential criminal defense situation besides Mr. Crumbley. To the rest of the folks out there, be sure to disregard the ignorant individuals reviews as that is a false representation of Mr. Crumbleys services. There is a good reason as to why you see his billboards all around our area and it’s for his consistently exceptional results. Another Satisfied Client

resp.text: Wow! I have fought for clients for 21 years but, as far as I know, this is the first time a client has fought for me. I never really thought about clients reading other people's reviews before they write their own but I guess they do. I think you were more upset than I was. But, I have learned over the years that people see things, view things, expect things and interpret things differently from each other. As they say: "one man's trash is another man's treasure". EVERYTHING must be ALWAYS viewed with the proper perspective. I appreciate your strong, heartfelt words but they weren't necessary. We take cases all across the board and that includes cases that are very difficult and filled with a multitude of considerations, possibilities and opportunities - even for failure. Sometimes the absolute best outcome still falls short of the perfect outcome. I think most people understand that. Having said that, God Bless you young man. Many thanks! ~ Russell

name: mike money
text: I retained Mr. Crumbley to represent me on a DUI in the city of Madison. I had heard a lot of good things about him and his firm from other people that had used his services. I scheduled a consultation and went to meet Mr. Crumbley. I was very nervous about my situation, but within minutes he had me at ease and feeling confident we would win this case. During our meeting, Mr. Crumbley was very professional and knowledgeable and easy to talk to. I followed his advice and we took the case to a jury trial in the higher court. We were scheduled court dates several times and each time I went, the court wasn’t able to try the case at that time and would reschedule at a later date. Jump forward 6 years (that’s our court system), and the court finally scheduled a court date. So since it had been 6 years, I had moved a couple of times so the court didn’t have my current address so I was never notified of the new date. Mr. Crumbley still appeared in court on my behalf, he informed the court that he had tried to contact me but was unable to reach me. The court was talking about doing several different things, but Mr. Crumbley kept fighting on my behalf to reach a solution that was in my best interest. The day after my court date, I had a missed call, I called the number and it was Mr. Crumbley’s office. His staff found out who had tried to contact me, next thing I know, Mr. Crumbley was on the phone. He told me about the missed court date, and I’m thinking Ok, bench warrant!!! He continued to tell me the news….Case is Dismissed!!! What better outcome could there be. Thanks Russell.

resp.text: Mike: THANK YOU for that. But, I just did what you hired me to do ... I kept fighting. And, it certainly worked out better than I expected. Just goes to show ... you never know until you go try. God Bless!

resp.text: Jacob: It is very disappointing to see your level of disappointment. After a review of our records, it appears as though this review stems from issues about 10 years ago. Jon and I bend over backwards for our clients to try to get the best results possible. We have tried many cases in front of a jury. We get MOST cases dismissed and, of course,  some clients do enter a guilty plea. However, every case is different and has it's own variables, nuances and circumstances (both in fact and in law). For that reason, alone, we never make promises or guarantees - even when we believe we could. That is just not good business. The ONLY thing I know to do is to reach out to you and I have done that - to no avail. My office and my phone line remain open to you. In either event, we wish you nothing but the best. ~ Russell

name: Bob Adkins
text: My family used this attorneys office to handle the process of a large estate from probate to closing of two sales from the land and home.  This  event started in 2020 and finally resolved in spring of 2021.    The response from the members on his team has been pathetic at best.  Not returning phone calls or emails so many times.  I would have to follow up several times to make sure what I had requested was being done on various issues.   We have been told incorrect information during probate causing us a lot of extra work when it wasn't required.   Then at closing, I had to point out several items that were not correct and even the fee we were told to pay wasn't correct.  Actually, the fee was short from what was discussed and we corrected saving them a loss.   The lawyer did not seem to know the details of the closing when we pointed out discrepancies and had to go ask his staff.   The front office lady was very sweet and helpful.  However, the remaining staff we dealt with was unorganized and unprofessional.   For the amount we paid,  we feel we did not receive good service as the process and experience was difficult and frustrating throughout.   Then we still have one outstanding matter we asked for them to provide legal documents on and  over a month has passed with no communication from the office.   I have followed up 3 times and still no response.     I thought a small town attorney office would have been a very good experience to work with, but I was wrong.   I would not recommend.   I hope they improve their service.

name: Daniel Tarpley
text:
I first met Mr. Matthews over a year ago when the first stages of what would become my divorce was just beginning to surface. What started out as a simple consultation to learn what my rights would be if divorce became real would ultimately become a saving grace.

If I had to describe Mr. Matthews I would say he is a very straight shooter that will not try to sell you "hopes and dreams" or "blow smoke" just to get money out of you. He will definitely let you know where you stand and how things are, and believe me sometimes that is definitely what you need even if you may not want to hear it.

Another thing about Mr. Matthews I can say is that he has the experience and know how to go about your case. He knows the exact moment and places to strike to when it matters the most. In my own situation, Mr. Matthews delivered such an amazing defense in an emergency hearing that at that exact moment after nearly a year of feeling beaten, battered, bruised and so tired that I was about ready to give up. He managed to unravel my now ex-wife's entire testimony with just a single question. Mr. Matthews did such a good job that after a few follow up questions the judge stopped the hearing, and I didn't even have to get on the stand to defend myself.

Then a few weeks later Mediation came around, and the tone suddenly shifted from everything my ex-wife wanted to pretty much everything I wanted. I have to thank Mr. Matthews so much because thanks to him and his amazing defense I now have my name cleared, and I can be the father to my children that I always wanted to be.

I also want to extend a thank you to Mr. Matthews team. You will not find a more friendly and knowledgeable staff that is prompt with informing Mr. Matthews of your concerns and questions, and getting that information back to you.

So if what your looking for is an hometown attorney that won't steer you wrong, won't try to sell you a line, and give you a true blue unquestionable defense then  look no further than Mr. William Matthews.

text: I am definitely giving Dean Waite and his office 5 stars. He was beyond everything we were looking for in an accident attorney. My husband was in a motorcycle accident at the end of January and was in the hospital for over a week. We called Dean’s office and explained the situation and they said he would call us back as soon as he reviewed our case. He personally called us back 5 minutes later. He asked if we could meet and when I told him we were in the hospital he said I will be there soon. He visited us in the hospital on a Sunday afternoon and immediately treated us like family. We went over our case and he immediately accepted it. He was in contact with us every other day or so which gave us piece of mind know he was actively working our case. After a couple of weeks we were told the Insurance company was denying our claims for the accident. We thought we had lost he case and we couldn’t do anything else. Dean worked for a few days on trying to get our claim accepted and finally after a few days it was approved. Dean is the nicest and most professional attorney I’ve met. I would HIGHLY recommend him and his office.
