name: Chassidy Hammond
text: I would definitely recommend Dean Wait’s office! After a car accident, the insurance company of the at-fault driver denied my medical claims. I contacted Dean Waite’s office after a friend’s recommendation. All of his staff were very friendly and helpful. I asked a lot of questions because I don’t know much about the legal process. They were patient, informative, and kept me updated. I do not live in AL (where the accident ocurred), so though I did meet Dean Waite in office on a few occasions, they allowed me to handle most matters by email. The insurance company wanted to settle out of court with partial compensation. Dean Waite’s team took my case to trial. They had to prove fault because of a lacking police report. I had to testify, and his team was very helpful in calming my nerves! Dean Waite’s office won my case and I received full compensation for my injuries. I most appreciated their availability, patience in explaining the process, and how quickly they responded to my emails (even after hours).

resp.text: Chassidy-  I"m so glad we were able to obtain a favorable result for you after the insurance company treated you so unfairly. name: Sheila Croston
text: We were hit by a school bus, which resulted in a 4 surgery case. Tabatha, an associate of Mr. Waite told my husband and me we were old and they wouldn't be able to get us much in our case, because we had existing physical problems. I guess they don't think us, 60 year olds deserve  to be treated like the victims of a school bus running a stop sign and causing, over $14,000 worth of damage to our vehicle, deserve compensation for our injuries. I would not recommend them if you are older, not sure how they treat younger people. We went with a different law firm, which was probably the best thing for us.

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Croston,

I was disappointed to see this review on Google, especially since in June 2018 we received an email from you reading "Thank you. We appreciate your hard work." I'm not sure why you have reversed course now, but I would like to take a moment to respond.

I proudly represent people of all ages and from all walks of life, and my firm and I have gotten great results for many older clients. Every case is different, and every situation has pros and cons. Part of my job as an attorney and counselor at law is to advise my clients of all factors, both positive and negative, that may affect their claims. In injury cases, age and medical history are among those factors.

We discussed with you the factors that would affect your case, as we would with any other client. While we are always cognizant of the sensitivity of these issues, in my experience, being up front and frank with my clients is the way to provide better representation and better results.

Please feel free to call me at (251) 265-1000 to discuss this matter further. I wish you the very best of luck.

Sincerely,
Attorney Dean Waite

name: nah nah
text: Very Gladly I was referred to Dean's law office.  The day after my accident, on a Saturday, Dean met me at Starbucks to discuss my case.  I am sure He handles cases involving much more money than my case, yet his helpfulness, guidance & availability to me in the weeks following my accident were stellar. 1st, I would not have gotten a car rental from the insurance company of the driver that caused my accident after mine was totaled without Dean's help/guidance. 2nd,  I texted his personal cell phone on a Saturday night after arriving at home to a high anxiety causing letter from the insurance company of the person that caused my accident.  Dean replied within 5 minutes, and with great interest in my inquiry! Asking questions i hadn't thought of in order to fully understand my status & give the most accurate reply. I was put very much at ease. 3rd, I stopped into Dean's office the 1st time unannounced by text, phone or email.  I had multiple questions ranging from money to get my stitches removed to whether I needed to obtain a police report and wanted only to speak to the staff member in charge of my case.  Before I could finish saying my name to the receptionist, Dean exited his office and greeted me. And although he had a meeting in 20 minutes & i offered to just ask a staff member, he wouldn't leave until all of my 5 or 6 questions were personally answered.  4th, Attorney Derek Siebert, in charge of my case, did a phenomenal job for me.  He contacted me multiple times to explain my options & offer opinion if I desired. He was truly in my corner for me.  Lastly, but very very impressive to me, every member of Dean's staff i had any interaction with treated me with great courtesy & with professionalism.  I felt very & truly cared for as a client.  I wouldn't recommend any one else.

resp.text:
Ms. Moore- I was certainly disappointed to see your review.  After investigating your claim, we determined that there was no automobile insurance coverage available to cover your car accident.  As such, we sent a letter to you advising you that we could not handle your case.  This letter was sent to the address we had on file for you.  I am sorry if you somehow never received word of our decision.  This is honestly the first time I've heard that you were not aware that we couldn't represent you.

I certainly wish you the best.   Please give me a call if you'd like to discuss this matter in greater detail.  I'm more than happy to talk with you about it.

Dean Waite

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Robinson,

I was disappointed to see your negative review on Google concerning my firm and wanted to take a moment to respond. While I do remember speaking with you about your potential case, I need to point out that I declined to represent you and you were never an actual client of my firm. Unfortunately, there are many reasons why I may not be able to accept a particular case. When I believe I will not be able to reach a positive outcome, I make it my policy to decline the case in order to avoid setting unrealistic expectations for the injured person.

Out of respect for your privacy I will not share the details of why I was not able to represent you in this public forum, but please feel free to call me at (251) 265-1000 and I would be happy to offer further explanation. I wish you the very best of luck.

Sincerely,
Attorney Dean Waite

In your case, we went to great lengths to reduce our attorney’s fee and get your medical bills reduced as much as possible so that you would walk away with the greatest possible amount of money for your injuries. We understand that every client comes to us in a bad situation, with all the understandable frustrations that come along with it, and we work hard every day to help make the best possible outcome out of such situations.

Attorney Dean Waite

name: Joyce Edwards
text: Mr. Smith and his paralegal Ms. Mason went above and beyond to obtain the best possible settlement in my divorce. Because this was the end of a 33 year marriage they were very thorough in obtaining all the information needed in order to have a fair division of financial and property assets, along with the facts needed in obtaining a fair alimony settlement. I had moved to another state for my own peace of mind, but I was always kept informed. I did have to return for a temporary support hearing and mediation, which was to be expected. From the time my ex-spouse was served with papers to the finalization of the the divorce was about 7 months.  I feel very blessed that Mr. Smith and Ms. Mason were able to bring closure as quickly as they did in my contested divorce process. Mr. Smith knows the family law concerning divorce matters and can go about this process in a calm and respectful manner to everyone that's involved yet get his point across in the best interest of his client. If you are needing a divorce lawyer that will be looking out for you - his client I highly recommend Mr. Smith and his staff.

resp.text: Joyce, thank you very much for the wonderful review. We genuinely appreciate all of the positive feedback.

I'm very happy I was able to get joint custody of my 2yo son and I couldn't be more happy by the outcome of the case. Just help him out by getting the things u need to prove in court, and he will do the rest.

name: Marsida Cami
text: Reply to Brian Sullivan: Please dont advertise lies about this law firm you told me numerous times how disappointed you were in their services, Mr. Mcghee gave Mr. Sullivan a percentage off his legal fees, if he gave a good review!! False advertisement Really!! My true story: My now ex husband and I went through a chaotic divorce and his lawyer was Mr. McGhee. My experience is based on what I dealt with in phone and email conversations as well as what was told to me by my ex husband and McGhee's  Secretary and how the divorce was handled. First Mr. Mcghee, does not like to speak to people that are "Pro Se" (representing yourself) so even though you worked for over 10 years in the law field as a paralegal and you can easily save your money by doing the settlement and divorce yourself, Shawn McGhee will make sure to give you a hard time. Not only does he lie and says there is a conflict of interest, which is why he won't speak to you which by the way, THAT IS NOT TRUE, but he will not answer any of the calls. For whatever reason he was not able to speak to me which to me seems very unprofessional, he would often have his secretary let me know what was needed for the divorce to be settled. I think because I do know what I needed to do legally, and trust me lawyers hate people that have worked in law fields you cant pull a sheet over legal assistants or paralegals eyes easily, we know all the tricks.  Now his secretary had given me some information that had holes in what she said that included the discovery process and hearings as well as the laws. Because of the communication between me and her and then what she told my ex husband of what I said, which were twisted, this made the divorce messy and long . And I believe the reason was for trial which is very expensive, but lawyers love expensive. Now one thing which is grounds for a grievance is that Mr. McGhee gave advice on the amount of payments for child support that should be paid which is unethical and should only be done by a referee. Mr. Mcghee, has no compassion for children as he informs his clients that they don't need to be responsible parents and pay for the kids until a judge says so, which to me makes me wonder about his character. Being out of state I was not able to do much, and my ex did not even live in Alabama as law requires in order to file but as usual somehow McGhee got around that. I have worked for law firms since I was 16 years old I could never work for someone that does things that are unethical, shady and down right wrong  he has no moral character, and I would be scared if my papers would be questioned by a judge with the amount of lies that my ex and his lawyer gave to me.  Please look at other Law firms that will look at your case and care enough to not control your decisions and won't run up your bill for no reason. Me and my ex husband  managed to settle together without the hearsay talk of his lawyer. The issue I have is there are amazing lawyers out there and Mr. Mcghee is the reason that lawyers have such a bad reputation. Make sure you chose a lawyer that will care about your interests and especially the kids, don't let the kids get lost in the divorce they are the most important thing, don't let the lawyer stress you or the other party or you will cause more harm and extend something that is not good for anyone. And make sure to hold your ground. Research on your lawyer don't chose someone because they are cheap eventually they will show you why they are cheap, Mr. Mcghee was affordable for my ex-husband until hearings and trial came around and then up goes his hourly. Don't be fooled.

resp.text: At Smith & McGhee, we always strive to treat our clients with the utmost of respect and professionalism and we work tirelessly on their behalf. We also recognize that, unfortunately, not every case has a positive outcome, nor do the facts of every case warrant continued legal action. But, we always advise our clients of their best options and remedies. In our continued efforts to address any negative responses to our Google Comments, we have reviewed our client records to try and locate your file. Unfortunately we do not have any records of you being a client of our firm. This leaves us no way to answer your negative review except to assume you may have reviewed the wrong law firm.  If you feel this is in error, please feel free to contact our office at your earliest convenience to discuss any issues or questions you may have.

text: In 2013 the car I was driving was rearended by a tractor trailer in Montgomery. In the vehicle with me were four other members of my family. There was not much damage to the rear of my car. When I asked for the insurance company for the tractor trailer to compensate me and my family for our injuries they refused. I guess they did not think we were hurt because the damage to my car was not that bad. But I had to have to have neck surgery as a result of my injuries. I hired Jeff Hunter to be my lawyer and he filed a lawsuit against the truck driver and his employer. Jeff fought hard for me and my family and we ended up receiving over $295,000.00 in a settlement. Without Jeff Hunter representing us we could not have  received such a great settlement. Jeff Hunter cares about his client and wants to get them as much money as he can. I highly recommend Jeff Hunter if you need a personal injury attorney.

name: Kelly Horwitz
text:
My husband and I are both lawyers, but not experts in probate. We both have high expectations of lawyers - he teaches ethics - so when we needed to make an estate plan, we were not going to pay for slipshod work.

One of our friends referred us to Ms. Gregory and we couldn't have been more pleased. She took the time to walk through our particular circumstances and was efficient and thorough in the documents she prepared. No one wants to face their own mortality and make these preparations, but she approaches these issues with professionalism and thoughtfulness. In the time since she's done our estate plan, we've sent several friends to her and all have been satisfied.

I was surprised to see a negative review, but it made sense when I saw that it alluded to her decision to run for office. I understand one may disagree with that decision, but I hate to see a political disagreement reflect poorly upon her professional rating. It simply is unwarranted.
